loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who runs a food kiosk. She says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

Mwanasha is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, fish, milk, maize flour, and sugar for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, fish, milk, maize flour, and sugar

loans.name: Lizeth Vanessa

texts.es:
Vanessa es una joven de 18 años, es una persona que desde la infancia se ha proyectado hacia el futuro, soñaba sacar grado del colegio y lo logro con mucho esfuerzo, ella era muy buena estudiante siempre sobresalía, vivía en una vereda de la cual tuvo que desplazarse a vivir a una ciudad,  pese a los conflictos que en la vereda se venían presentando entre grupos al margen de la ley y sumándole a esto las necesidades económicas al interior del núcleo familiar y también por la falta de universidades para poder cumplir con las metas e ideales, ella vive con los padres en una casa muy humilde la cual esta a cargo del padre, al cual le toca trabajar largas jornadas para poder afrontar todas las necesidades del hogar, esta joven siempre ha soñado con ser médica, pero por las dificultades económicas, ella tomo la decisión de estudiar auxiliar en enfermería y  está cursando el segundo semestre, ya que es más económica y va encaminada a la medicina, pues siempre le ha gustado servir a los demás sin esperar nada a cambio, hasta el momento le ha tocado con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio  para llegar hasta donde esta; también sueña con ser una profesional y poderle ayudar económicamente a los padres y mejorar la calidad de vida.
La situación económica de la familia no es la mas estable, es por eso que ella necesita del convenio con kiva para que el valor de las cuotas que tiene que cancelar sea un poco mas económico y a el papa no le quede tan pesado el pago de lso gastos de la casa y ayudarle a la hija para poder pagar las cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Vanessa is an 18 year old young women.  From a young age, she has been a person who has always looked towards the future.  She dreamt of earning her high school diploma, which she achieved with a lot of effort.  She was a very good student and always excelled.  She lived in a village, which she later had to leave to live in the city because of the conflicts that were presenting themselves in the village between gangs, as well as the financial needs of her family and the lack of a university where she could achieve her goals.  She lives with her parents in a humble home where her father is the provider and must work long hours to provide for the household.  

This young woman has always dreamt of being a doctor, but due to her financial difficulties, she decided to study nursing because it is more economical and is still in the medical field.  She is now in her second semester.  She has always enjoyed serving others without expecting anything in return.  Up to now, she has had to put in a lot of effort and sacrifice a lot to get to where she is.  

Her family's financial situation is not the most stable, which is why she is in need of help from Kiva to make her tuition payments a little more manageable, and so that her father is no longer as burdened behaving to provide for the household and helping his daughter to pay for her tuition.

loans.use: pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Zulakhan

texts.en:
Zulakhan is a 34-year-old married woman and has sold milk with her husband  for many years. They have 2 cows and sell the milk to many of their neighbors. Her husband uses his motor bike daily to sell milk in different communities. 

They happily work together to support their family. They have four children, two of them attend school. They need to earn much more to meet their daily expenditures which include food, clothing and education. In order to make huge profits, Zulakhan requests 60,000 PKR to buy another buffalo to help increase their sales and profits and attract  more customers..

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 32-year-old married woman who has sold milk for many years. She has 3 cows and sells milk and butter to many of her neighbors. 

Her business is good enough to provide a decent life for her seven children.  Two of her children attend school. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life, a good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet daily expenses. 

She requests 40,000 PKR to purchase another cow. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married mother of three children, two of whom attend school; one is still young. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees

For the past year she has operated a detergent selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby . She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase litres of detergents to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase litres of detergents to sell

loans.name: Wendy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Wendy de 19 años de edad, es una joven que solo estudio quinto grado se acompañó y tiene una niña de 9 meses; luego se separó y se vio en la necesidad de buscar un trabajo y decidió por el comercio de ropa.  Ella dice que es una oportunidad para crecer y tener una mueva experiencia,  dice le va muy bien y tiene la esperanza de darle el estudio a su hija. 

Ella le hubiera gustado ser policía, pero se dejó llevar por su corazón dice, pero le gustaría que su hija fuera secretaria; pero antes dice tiene que trabajar muy duro para lograrlo. 

El dinero lo necesita para comprar ropa para el negocio y trabajar en la agricultura, ya que dice que un poco es suficiente para tomar impulso y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Wendy, 19, is a young woman who only studied up to fifth grade.  She was married and had a nine-month-old daughter, but then separated.  She had to find a job, so she decided to sell clothing.  She said it's an opportunity to grow and have a new experience.  It's going very well for her and she hopes to give her daughter an education.

Wendy said she would like to have been a police officer but that she got carried away by love.  She would like for her daughter to be a secretary, but she'll have to work very hard to achieve that.

She needs the money to buy clothes for her business and to work in agriculture.  She said a little bit is enough to get a running start and make progress.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her business and to work in agriculture

loans.name: Bertha Eligia

texts.es: Bertha tiene 62 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida quien es jornalero y sus dos hijos. Bertha se dedica a la venta de variedad de fruta fresca como: jocotes, guineos, piñas, etc. Es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Bertha desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales dado que su casa es pequeña y las bases se encuentran en mal estado. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de su casa a base de lámina galvanizada y madera. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento dado que de esta forma espera dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Bertha is 62 years old and lives in her own home with her husband who is a day laborer, and their two children.  Bertha works selling a variety of fresh fruits such as: jocotes, bananas, pineapples, etc.  This is how she earns a living and provides for their home.  Bertha hopes to improve her housing conditions as their home is small and the structure is in poor condition.  

For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of her home made of galvanized sheet metal and wood.  She hopes to be able to secure this funding as she hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: purchase galvanized sheet metal and wood to build a small house.

loans.name: Roxene

texts.en:
Roxene is 40 years old and is married with one child who is currently in school. For the past ten years, she has sold fruit from a fruit stand. Roxene is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Roxene is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Doris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doris, supo invertir bien el crédito anterior en los materiales necesarios para elaborar la venta de tamales, pan, y otros antojitos, su negocio aumento la popularidad, tiene mejores ganancias, su familia tiene goza de una buena alimentación, educación y salud.
El crédito nuevo que está solicitando lo utilizara para comprar maíz, pollo, harina, azúcar, café, huevos, levadura, condimentos, etc., son parte de la materia prima para elaborar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Doris invested her previous loan well in the ingredients she needed to make tamales, bread, and other snacks.  The popularity of her business increased, she earns better profits, and her family enjoys good nutrition, education, and health.

She's requesting the new loan to buy some of the ingredients she needs to make her sales: corn, chicken, flour, sugar, coffee, eggs, leavening, condiments, etc.

loans.use: to buy corn, chicken, flour, sugar, coffee, eggs, leavening, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman and has been blessed with two kids who attend school. For the past three years, she has operated a business selling poultry. Her major business challenge is disease outbreaks. Esther lives in her own house with electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expense is school fees. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Esther is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase chicks and poultry feed. In the future, she dreams of becoming a poultry wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement for his business

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar is 34 years old and a married woman. She is the mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Kousar’s husband, who is a driver by profession. He provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now the vehicle requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Kousar has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires with some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Kousar is hopes that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some auto spare parts, for the rickshaw

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a 35-year-old, married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as "determined." She operates a farm, where she grows potatoes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area, and her customers are of all kinds. She says her biggest business challenge is climate change. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to own a large piece of land, within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will economically sustain her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana de 19 años de edad,  habita en un lugar muy cercano al mar; desde allí vende mercancía variada  a través de guías especializadas de productos, que le provisionan empresas multinacionales. En su oferta tiene mercancía que están a mejor precio y por eso siempre debe tener un disponible para comprarla y entregar a su clientela, la mejor opción de ahorro cuando a ella le compran. Ana tiene un año de tener su negocio y empezó a vender entusiasmada por su madre, quien es una experta comerciante. Ella hoy día vende perfumes, cosméticos y accesorios femeninos, que ofrece de contado y a crédito, todos los días de 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y por eso sueña con tener un local propio, donde exhibir su mercancía e impactar la vista de los clientes y generar su acción de compra. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cosméticos, accesorios femeninos, cremas y perfumes para incrementar los inventarios y poder entusiasmar a su clientela, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión efectiva.
texts.en:
Ana is 19 years old and lives close to the ocean.  From there, she sells a variety of merchandise through special product catalogs from international companies.  She offers merchandise at a better price, and because of that, she must have the capital to purchase it and sell it to her customers.  Purchasing from her is the best way to save.  Ana has had her business for a year, and she started to sell with her mother who is an experienced saleswoman.  She sells perfumes, cosmetics and feminine accessories, which she offers on credit and in cash.  She works everyday from 8am to 8pm.  Her main customers are her neighbors, which is why she dreams of having her own retail space where she can display her merchandise and place them in the line of sight of her customers to promote their purchases.  

She is now applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to purchase cosmetics, feminine accessories, creams and perfumes to increase her inventory and excite her customers, making her Kiva loan an effective investment.

loans.use: purchase cosmetics, female accessories, creams and perfumes.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is 34 years old and a married woman. Her husband is successfully running a small general store, at the corner of their home. Shakeela is the mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing and health care.

For the improvement of her husband’s business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR. It will help him to purchase stock, including rice, sugar, oil and beverages. This will help him to meet the increasing demand at his store. She is expecting a boost in her husband’s earnings, and she dreams of providing a better standard of living to her children.

loans.use: to purchase stock, including rice, sugar, oil and beverages.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 31-year-old energetic woman with 2 children. She has sewn clothes for many years. She works hard to provide food, clothing, and good health for her family.

Her husband is employed in a factory. His income is not sufficient to meet the family's daily expenditures. She started her business to contribute to the family's income.  She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

She requests 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy different colored  thread, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to increase revenue and  generate a stronger source of income. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy different colored spools of thread, packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a married man with 5 children between the ages of 15 and  22. He describes himself as business oriented.

He has operated a motorcycle transportation business for 2 years. His business is located in a local area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as robbery. He will use 15,000 KES to buy spare parts to service his motorcycle. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with two young children. She lives at her own house without electricity and running water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a kerosene selling business for the past year.She cites transportation costs as her major challenge.

She is requests a loan to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more drinks, soap, and many other items for her business.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Shirley has requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like noodles, spices, vegetables, fish, meat, etc. for her business.

Shirley has been in this business for 16 years now.

In the future, Shirley would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like noodles, spices, vegetables, fish, meat, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy works hard to support her family. Mercy is married and has a meat vending business in the Philippines.

Mercy requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more meat to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for five years now.

Mercy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman who lives in a rental house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family.

For the past year, she has operated a business to sell wheat, rice and maize. She states that theft and competition are her major business challenges. 

She requests 40,000 KES to purchase  wheat, maize,and rice. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase  wheat, maize,and rice.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
This is Chizi. She previously accessed a loan to purchase goats for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She currently requests another loan to purchase additional goats.

She appreciates Kiva for their financial support with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase more goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh milk, lunch meat, and other items for his business.

loans.name: Rogelio Alexander

texts.es: Rogelio tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos de 13 años, 12 años, 10 años y 3 años de edad. Rogelio trabaja como albañil desde hace tres años y es así como lleva el sustento a su familia. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, cemento, grava y ladrillo, dado que desea construir una fosa séptica y encementar el piso de la vivienda. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento para proceder lo antes posible a las mejoras.
texts.en:
Rogelio tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos de 13 años, 12 años, 10 años y 3 años de edad. Rogelio trabaja como albañil desde hace tres años y es así como lleva el sustento a su familia. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, cemento, grava y ladrillo, dado que desea construir una fosa séptica y encementar el piso de la vivienda. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento para proceder lo antes posible a las mejoras. 

Rogelio is 32 years old and lives in his own house with his partner and four children aged 13, 12, 10 and 3. Rogelio has worked as a builder for three years to support his family. He is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy sand, cement, gravel and bricks, as he wants to build a septic tank and put a cement floor down in his home. He hopes that this loan will allow him to start as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, gravel and bricks to build a septic tank and put a cement floor down in his home.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane  is married with three children and all her children attend school. She also takes care of her brother. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses  include rent and school fees.

She has a retail market business to sell charcoal and has been in this business for 8 years.  Jane works six days a week.

She requests 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy charcoal.  Her major business challenges include transportation and in-climate weather. She wants to becoming a wholesaler and buy a delivery vehicle to help with transportation. 

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because it helps the poor.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina sells soap from her residence in Teshie. She is a 55-year-old woman who has a strong commitment to improve her standard of living.

She is very kind and careful with her clients and during these years of her work was able to gather a good client base. Faustina has now applied for 1,300 GHS to purchase  assorted soaps to sell to her customers. 

Karine will be very grateful if lenders help her with this loan and support her small business.

loans.use: to purchase assorted soaps to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marysali

texts.en:
Marysali is married and has four children. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and fees for her kids.

For over two years, she has operated a tailoring business where she makes garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. In addition to her tailoring business, she sells clothes to supplement her income. Marysali dreams of establishing a boutique in the near future.

With the 25,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase fabric and thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is married and has six adult children. She has operated a fish selling business for over 10 years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

Kadzo requested a loan from Yehu for 35,000 KES, which she will use to purchase bundles of fish to sell. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy raw materials for making woven products.

loans.name: Ngumba

texts.en:
Ngumba appreciates  her previous loan that improved her living standards by enabling her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She was able to meet her family's needs.

She would like to apply for a loan to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, beans and sugar for her business.

Ngumba thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, beans and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a married woman with four children. Lilibeth is 53 years old and has one child in school.

She is a very hard working entrepreneur and is a soft-drink dealer in the Philippines. Lilibeth has been in this business for 5 years.  She requests 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more cases of soft-drinks.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more cases of soft-drinks to sell.

loans.name: Nazaria

texts.en:
Nazaria is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nazaria is 54 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Nazaria has a rug-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her rug-making business.

Nazaria has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her rug-making business

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika operates a business to sell beans and chapati (flat bread) to passersby and neighbors. She states that the high cost of ingredients is her major challenge. 

She will use 50,000 KES to purchase  wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fashionable clothing such as jeans and tee-shirts for his business.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah  is a single mother  of four children, two of her children attend school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

She has sold chips for 8 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy cooking oil and Irish potatoes. She works at the market seven days every week. Her major business challenges include changing seasons and customers that miss payments. She wishes to own a restaurant and  become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Rayma

texts.en:
Rayma is 46 years old and has a live-in partner with five children.

Rayma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Rayma has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

Rayma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosmeri

texts.es:
Rosmeri de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado. Ella es casada, su esposo se dedica a trabajar como educador  en la escuela del cantón. Juntos han  procreado tres hijos el primero estudia,  el segundo estudia  y la tercera aun no estudia por su edad. 
   
Ell se dedica a trabajar en un negocio de productos de la canasta básica, desde hace 6 años; aprendió la actividad ya que cuando se casó con su esposo no tenía una actividad  que le generara ingresos económicos. Su esposo decidió ponerle el negocio para que se ocupara en ello, poco a poco este creció y lo fortaleció con las ganancias que le generaba. Fue como decidió seguir en esta actividad, por el momento solo esta actividad tiene, antes tenía una pequeña sala de belleza donde hacia tintes en el cabello y uñas. Su negocio lo tiene en su casa y no tiene que caminar para trabajar. Su esposo es quien le colabora en el negocio cuando está en casa y en ocasiones le ayuda su padre.
   
El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar dos quintales de frijol, 2 quintales de azúcar, 5 cajas de jugos,  5 cajas de sodas, 5 paquetes de galletas, 5 fardos de sopas maruchan y 50 libras de pollo que han encargado.

Ella manifiesta que con las ganancias pretende ampliar su negocio comprando más mercadería y ofrecer  un mejor servicio a los clientes. Por otra parte, quiere ayudar a su esposo a comprar dos vacas lecheras para que hayan alimentos para su familia y si es necesario vender lo hará.
texts.en:
Rosmeri is 35 years old. She has a ninth-grade education. She is married and her husband works as an educator in their rural community's school. Together, they have produced three children; the first and second are in school, and the third is not yet in school because of her age.

Rosmeri works selling everyday household staples. Her husband decided to set up the business for her to run. Little by little, it has grown and strengthened with the earnings it has generated, so she decided to continue with the business. This is currently her only business; before, she had a small beauty shop where she did hair color and nails. Her business is in her house, so she doesn't have to walk to work. Her husband contributes to the business when he is home, and occasionally her father helps her.
   
The loan that she is requesting from CrediCampo is for the purchase of two quintals of beans [1 Salvadoran quintal = 46 kilos], two quintals of sugar, five cases of juices, five cases of sodas, five packages of cookies, five bundles of Maruchan instant noodle soup, and fifty pounds of chicken that she has ordered. 

She states that she plans to use her earnings to expand her business by buying more merchandise and offering a better services to her customers. She also wants to help her husband to buy two milk cows in order to have food for her family and, if necessary, to sell.

loans.use: to purchase two quintals of beans, two quintals of sugar, five cases of juices, five cases of sodas, five packages of cookies, five packages of Maruchan instant noodle soup, and fifty pounds of chicken that she has ordered.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Rosita is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to buy additional groceries like snack foods, soft drinks, milk, cereals, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries like snack foods, soft drinks, milk, cereals, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Moises Elias

texts.es:
Moisés, tiene 42 años, es padre de dos hijos, de 22 y 18 años, vive junto a ellos y su madre quien ya es una anciana de avanzada edad, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, esta actividad la lleva a cabo desde que era muy joven. Trabaja de lunes a sábado, al momento de solicitar el crédito no representa ningún riesgo.
El crédito le servirá para tener los insumos agrícolas necesarios para realizar los procesos de preparación del terreno para sembrar y obtener granos de calidad que venderá más fácil, comprara abono, insecticidas, fertilizantes y semilla.
Su sueño es tener un área más grande de cultivo para tener mejores ingresos y dar a su familia una vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Moisés is 42 years old and the father of two children, ages 22 and 18. He lives with his children and his elderly mother. Moisés grows corn and beans and has been doing this type of work since he was a very young man. He works Monday through Saturday. At the moment, he is requesting a loan since it does not present any risk.

The loan will be used to acquire needed farming supplies for preparing the land for planting. As a result, he will able to achieve quality output that will be easier to sell. Moisés will buy compost, insecticides, fertilizers, and seeds.

His dream is to have a larger area for planting so that he can generate more income and provide his family a life that is much more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, fertilizers, and seeds.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Cheryl has been in this business for 11 years. She earns additional income from pig-fattening and raising goats.

Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Walter Alexander

texts.es:
Walter tieme 35 años,  esta soltero y tiene 2 hijos, él es peluquero desde muy joven se dedico a este trabajo  y hasta el momento ha sido la fuente de trabajo que le ha permitido salir adelante y sacar a sus dos hijos y darles el estudio que necesita. 

 Walter posee una peluqueria desde hace 5 años, el trabajo de corte de cabello, lo aprendió de su padre quien le enseño desde muy pequeño. Para él la unica actividad economica que tiene es lo que es el negocio de la peluqueria, su negocio lo tiene en su propia casa.

 El  préstamoque esta soliictando, es  para mejorar su peluqueria  y asi poder darles un mejor servicio a los clientes del que ya les da. Él desea ampliar su negocio y comprar otros materiales que le hagan falta para realizar sus trabajo y sabe que con el crédito que ha adquirido lo puede lograr.

El sueño de Walter es poder mejorar su negocio y que en un futuro sea la mejor peluqueria y enseñarle a sus hijos lo que es el trabajo, para que un día pueda salir adelante y puedan lograr lo que ellos desean.
texts.en:
Walter is 35 years old. He is single and has two children. He is a barber. He started working when he was very young and so far this source of work is what has allowed him to get ahead, provide for his two children, and send them to school.

Walter has owned his barber shop for five years. He learned how to cut men's hair from his father, who taught him when he was very young. This barber shop is his only business, and it is located in his home.

He is requesting this loan to improve the barber shop so that he can provide his customers with even better services. He wants to expand his business and buy other materials he needs to do his job. He knows that he will be able to achieve this with the loan he is requesting.

Walter's dream is to be able to improve his business so that it becomes the best barber shop in the future. He wants to show his children what it means to work so that one day they can get ahead and achieve whatever they desire.

loans.use: to improve his barber shop.

loans.name: Yensi Mabel

texts.es: Yensi se encuentra muy feliz y muy satisfecha por la ayuda y apoyo financiero brindado por los inversionistas en la plataforma de KIVA en alianza con la cooperativa COMIXMUL. Ella compro los insumos como fertilizantes, abono, pago de mano de obra para limpieza y aplicación de insumos, y compra de diésel para la despulpadora con lo que consiguió excelentes resultados en la temporada. Ella manifiesta que de no haber recibido el financiamiento pudo hasta perder la cosecha porque no tenía los insumos ni el personal para corta del grano. También manifiesta que gracia a este financiamiento ahorro mucho en su cultivo ya que otras ocasiones ella pedía prestado a otras personas con una tasa de interés del 8% mensual por lo que solo para pagar deudas trabajaba. Diariamente lucha para salir adelante con su familia por lo que nuevamente ella solicita pueda ser apoyada con un segundo financiamiento para el mismo proyecto el cual invertirá siempre en el cultivo de café ya que con la cosecha que obtuvo cancelo su primer compromiso satisfactoriamente y las ganancias fueron invertidas en mejoras de sus cultivos y su vivienda siendo estas pocas para los diferentes compromisos a cumplir por lo que necesita volver asistir sus cultivos nuevamente ya que después de la corta y recolección estos quedaron un poco deteriorados y la tierra maltratada y sucia esperando ser nuevamente apoyada.
texts.en:
Yensi is very happy about and satisfied with the help and financial support from Kiva investors through the COMIXMUL cooperative.  She bought inputs such as fertilizer and soil amendments, paid for the labor to weed and apply the inputs, and bought diesel for her coffee pulper.  She got excellent results for the season. 

She said that without the loan she might even have lost the harvest because she didn't have the inputs or the personnel to cut the beans.  She also said she saved a lot on her crop thanks to this loan because on other occasions she had to borrow from people at an 8% monthly interest rate, which caused her to work only to repay the debts.

Yensi strives every day to get ahead with her family, so she's requesting another loan for the same project.  She's going to invest in her coffee crop because with her harvest she paid back her first loan satisfactorily and invested her profits in improvements to her crop and her home.

She has various commitments to fulfill and she needs to take care of her crops again.  After cutting and collecting, the plants are somewhat damaged and the soil battered and dirty, so they need more help.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crop

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
María de 61 años de edad,  estudio hasta tercero  grado, es soltera, tuvo tres hijos los que ya son mayores de edad, ellos trabajan, solo un hijo vive con ella.   


María es vendedora de tomates en el mercado, ya tiene varios años de realizar la actividad, la necesidad de tener ingresos la obligaron a dar inicio al negocio, no tiene más actividades que realizar, no tenía otro negocio antes de iniciar, de su casa a al mercado recorre unos 5 km diarios, nadie más se dedica a las ventas, las ventas las realiza de 6 am a 9 am.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar tomates, chiles, entre otras verduras.

Su deseo es continuar en el negocio e ir  poco a poco creciendo las ventas y la clientela, tener una estabilidad mejor, espera que el negocio le dé más resultado, con lo que le ayudara a poder tener su propio capital de trabajo, las ganancias serán invertidas en el pago de la cuota y ampliación del negocio.
texts.en:
María is 61 years old and studied up to third grade. María is single and has three children, who are now adults. Her children work and only one son still lives with María.

María has been working selling tomatoes for a number of years. She started this business as she needed an income. She does not have any other job and this is María's first business. From her home to the market, María must travel five kilometres. Nobody else does this work. María works from 6 a.m. until 9 a.m.


This loan from "Credi Campo" will be used to buy tomatoes, chillis and other vegetables.

María's wish is to continue with her business and, little by little, to increase sales and her number of customers. María wants to be more stable and she hopes that her business will become more profitable. This would give her her own working capital and she can invest her profits in repaying the loan and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, chillis and other vegetables.

loans.name: Juana Lucia

texts.es:
Juana Lucia es originaria del municipio de Tecpan Guatemala, tiene 58 años de edad, tiene bajo su responsabilidad  a su hijo, ella tiene un local en el mercado donde vende refacciones y también se dedica a la crianza de pollos.
Desde hace algunos años ella se dedica a la  venta de refacciones y crianza de pollos y gracias a dios poco a poco a podido salir adelante.
El sueño de ella es surtir mas su negocio y así obtener mejores ganancias para poder mandar a su hijo a un mejor colegio para un futuro mejor ya que hoy en día la educación es muy importante, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para Comprar mercaderia para la elaboracion y venta de comida.
texts.en:
Juana Lucia is a native of the municipality of Tecpan Guatemala. She is 58 years old and has one son who she is responsible for. She has a stand in the market where she sells food and she also raises chickens. She has been doing this for several years now and things are going well for her, thanks to God.

Her dream is to stock her business and make more profits. She wants to send her son to a better school as to have a better future today education is very important. At this time she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to make and sell food.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to make and sell food.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 63-year-old married Lebanese man who lives with his wife. He has been working as a baker for the past 43 years. He spent all these years working very hard in his bakery to be able to earn enough income to meet the needs of life. Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase raw materials needed for his business. These purchases will help him continue operating his business by increasing his productivity and, therefore, his income. Ali is very optimistic and earns his living from his bakery, so these funds will definitely assist in enhancing his way of living.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed for his business

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi operates a business selling poultry. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business, but she dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 34 years old and married, with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 22,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been pig-fattening for 11 years and also earns additional income from nipa-roofing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: with the purchase of agricultural supplies and cleaning of her coffee crops

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, es parte de una familia que está conformada por su esposo y dos hijos de 8 y 9 años, no tiene ayuda financiera del extranjero, con el fin de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia instalo una tienda en su casa en la que ofrece a los vecinos productos de primera necesidad. Atiende de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Requiere de capital para comprar gaseosas, jugos, agua, sal, azúcar, pan, galletas, boquitas, arroz, dulces, etc., espera ahorrar, ya que al realizar compras por mayor los precios son más bajos, ofrece mejores ofertas a sus clientes y sus ganancias serán mucho mejor.
María tiene como objetivo hacer que su negocio sea más rentable para llevar acabo remodelaciones en su vivienda y seguir contribuyendo con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
María is married and has two children, aged nine and eight years old. She does not receive financial support from relatives living abroad. In order to support her husband with household costs, María set up a shop in her home where she sells basic staple goods. María serves customers from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m.

María needs this loan in order to buy fizzy drinks, juices, water, salt, sugar, bread, biscuits, snacks, rice, sweets and more. She hopes to save money on her purchases as she will buy in bulk and prices will be lower. María can then offer her customers better deals and she will have much higher profits.

María's goal is to make her business more profitable so that she can make improvements to her home and continue contributing to household costs.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks, juices, water, salt, sugar, bread, biscuits, snacks, rice, sweets and more.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Meet Benard, who lives and farms in the Eldoret area of North Rift, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He has been farming for 13 years. His primary income sources are milk and a variety of crops. Like most farmers in the area, he enjoys dairy farming the most. His biggest challenges are difficulty in acquiring feed and livestock diseases.

Benard chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they finance small-scale farmers with asset financing. During the training, he learned how to develop a savings culture. Through this dairy loan, there will be an improvement in milk production, leading to more income. This will improve his family's living standards as he looks to the future.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 69 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo. Juntos trabajan muy duro para ganarse el pan de cada día y mantener la economía del hogar. Juana se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollo de engorde desde hace mucho tiempo. Con mucho entusiasmo y humildad se acercó a FUSAI para solicitar este crédito el cual le permita construir una galera en el área donde tiene una pila y así poder protegerse del sol cuando hace uso de ella. COn el monto solicitado comprara madera, polines y lámina galvanizada.
texts.en: Juana is 69 and lives with her husband in a house they own. Together, they work very hard to earn their daily bread and maintain the economics of their home. Juana has worked in the raising and fattening of poultry for a long time. With a lot of enthusiasm and humility she approached FUSAI to request this credit which will allow her to build an awning over the area where she has a basin and therefore be able to protect herself from the sun when she uses it. With the sum applied for she will buy wood, poles and galvanized sheet.

loans.use: buy wood, poles and galvanized sheet to build an awning

loans.name: Roxalin

texts.es: Roxalin de 34 años de edad, habita al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y su hija de 10 años; ella es comerciante de  vestidos, jeans suéteres, calzado, bolsos Etc. Su negocio inició hace 6 años, siguiendo la tradición de su madre que es comerciante y tiene una miscelánea, de allí que cuando Roxalin y sus humanos  atendían el negocio de su progenitora, adquirieron el conocimiento que da la experiencia en el mercado y por eso hoy ella es una comerciante independiente, que genera ingresos para su propio hogar. En la actualidad vende sus productos mediante guías especializadas o catálogos, directamente al consumidor final, trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, ofreciendo a sus clientes las alternativas de  crédito y contado, para impulsar la compra; ellos son  los vecinos que habitan en el sector donde tiene la miscelanea o en barrios aledaños, donde los habitantes identifican su estado de comerciante. En la actualidad está aplicando  a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará jeans, calzado bolsos y suéteres que le han encargado.   Su credikiva es el segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el anterior crédito ha logrado incrementar su clientela y mantener surtida su miscelánea. Su mayor sueño es comprar su propia vivienda, y dejar de pagar arriendo, pero su desafío es lograr ingresos suficientes para alcanzar este tambien el sueño de prosperidad de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Roxalin is 34 years old and lives in the south of the city with her husband and her 10 year old daughter. She sells dresses, jeans, sweaters, shoes, bags etc. She started her business 6 years ago following in the footsteps of her mother who is a businesswoman and has a variety store. Roxalin and her siblings took care of the store for her mother, gaining experience in the market.

Today she is an independent merchant who generates income for her household. She sells her products using guides and catalogues directly to the end consumer. She works from 8 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon. She offers her clients both cash sales and credit to stimulate her sales. Her clients are neighbors who live in the area where the variety store is, or in adjoining neighborhoods who recognize her as a businesswoman.

Roxalin is requesting a loan from Kiva with which she will buy jeans, shoes, bags and sweaters which she has orders for. This is her second loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the last loan she increased her clientele and stocked her variety store. Her dream is to have her own house and not have to pay rent. Her challenge is to generate enough revenue to do this and she also dreams of her family becoming well off.

loans.use: to buy jeans, footwear, bags and sweaters.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a single mother of one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding, to increase her monthly income.

With the loan of KES 20,000, Mariam wants to purchase eight sacks of charcoal for resale and to pay for transport. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans, to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase eight sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Silvia Yanet

texts.es:
Silvia, tiene 38 años, está casada, su esposo tiene 42 años, tienen un hijo de 18 años el cual estudia, es propietaria de un taller de costura, lo atiende de lunes a sábado con apoyo de empleados, ella abastece de uniformes estudiantiles a diferentes escuelas.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de botones, zippers, hilos, telas, carreteles y pago de mano de obra, con estos materiales entregara a tiempo los pedidos y podrá continuar trabajando para otros clientes, espera que con dichas entregas las ganancias sean mejores.
Su deseo es mantenerse trabajando para que su familia tenga todo lo necesario para salir adelante y ofrecer más empleo.
texts.en:
Silvia is 38 years old. She is married and her husband is 42 years old. They have an eighteen-year-old son who is in school. She owns a tailoring shop and works there Monday through Saturday with help from her employees. She provides school uniforms for several schools.

She will invest this loan in buying buttons, zippers, thread, fabric, and spools, and also to pay for labor. These supplies will help her finish her orders on time so that she can continue working for other customers. She hopes that these deliveries will improve profits. 

She wants to keep working so that her family can have everything they need in order to get ahead. She also wants to be able to offer more employment opportunities.

loans.use: to buy buttons, zippers, thread, fabric, spools, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María, se encuentra sin capital para resurtir el inventario de su tienda, el nuevo crédito lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, bebidas, golosinas, azúcar, café, pan, galletas, lejía, jabón, etc., para que su negocio siga sobresaliendo por la satisfacción de sus clientes.
El crédito anterior le permitió tener mejor mercadería a la disposición sus clientes, sus circunstancias familiares son más confortables y cuenta con un buen record crediticio.
texts.en:
María finds herself without the capital to restock the inventory of her store. The new loan will be invested in the purchase of rice, drinks, candies, sugar, coffee, bread, cookies, bleach, soap, etc. so her business keeps excelling for the satisfaction of her customers.

The previous loan allowed her to have better merchandise available to her customers. Her family circumstances are more comfortable and she has a good loan record.

loans.use: to buy rice, drinks, candies, sugar, coffee, bread, cookies, bleach, soap, etc.

loans.name: Felipa De Jesus

texts.es: Felipa tiene 63 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo. Ella se  gana la vida por medio de la venta de deliciosas pupusas (preparación alimenticia  a base de masa de maíz, frijoles, queso, etc.) Tiene tres años de dedicarse a este negocio por lo que ya cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Felipa desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda dado que no posee puertas en buen estado y el piso de la vivienda es de tierra. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito FUSAI para invertir en la compra de puertas, cemento, arena y grava para proceder a la instalación de las puertas y  a encementar el piso de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Felipa is 63 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She makes a living selling delicious pupusas (thick corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, refried beans,etc.). She has run this business for three years and has many customers who like her more every day.

Felipa wants to improve her housing conditions since its doors are not in good condition has a dirt floor. Therefore, she is requesting this FUSAI loan to invest in buying doors, cement, sand, and gravel to install the doors and put a concrete floor in the house.

loans.use: to buy doors, cement, sand, and gravel to install doors and a concrete floor in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and repair the irrigation system for her crops.

loans.name: Ángel Bautista

texts.es:
Ángel es un joven de 20 años de edad. Esta acompañado con una muchacha a quien ama y respeta muchísimo, tienen una bebe de 6 meses de edad. Juntos trabajan arduamente para el bienestar de su pequeña. Ángel estudio hasta el tercer grado de educación básica, esto debido a los escasos recursos económicos en los que le se encontraba. A este tiempo ángel se dedica a la producción de pan, él es panificador, su esposa trabaja en una empresa atunera. 

Esto les ayuda mucho en los ingresos de la alimentación diaria para ellos y su pequeña Bebe. Ángel necesita el efectivo del préstamo para terminar de construir el techo de su casa, ademas necesita comprar tejas para su vivienda, y pagar lo que es el derecho para conectarse a la red de agua potable. Todo esto, con el fin de tener su propia casa y sus propios servicios. Mejorando así, su calidad de vida. 
El sueña a futuro es ver su casa totalmente remodelada, Brindarle a su pequeña todos los recursos necesarios para que no le falte nada, ademas darle así una educación que le permita desarrollarse profesionalmente. Algo que él no pudo lograr.
texts.en:
Ángel is a 20 year old young man. He is partnered with a woman who he loves and respects a lot. They have a 6 month old baby. Together, they work hard for the wellbeing of the little girl. Ángel only finished third grade due to the scarce economic resources in which he found himself. At this time, Ángel is dedicated to making bread. He is a baker. His wife works in a tuna company.

This helps them a lot with their income for the daily food for them and their little baby. Ángel needs the loan to finish building the roof of his house. Also he needs to buy tiles for his house and to pay for the right to connect the drinking water. All of this, with the goal to have his own house and their own bathroom thus improving their quality of life.

His dream for the future is to see his house completely remodeled, to provide his daughter with everything necessary so she does not lack anything, as well as give her an education that allows her to develop professionally, something he was not able to achieve.

loans.use: to buy tiles for his house and pay to connect to potable water.

loans.name: Dúo Merlos Group

texts.es: Dúo merlos doña Gregoria se dedica a la venta de comida, también helados, productos por catalogo, desde hace  ya hace 10 años se ha dedicado al negocio vendiendo desayunos, almuerzos y refacciones,  y  en su negocio tiene a la disposición artículos como, cremas, lociones, desodorantes,  calzado para aprovechar la visita de quienes llegan a su negocio,en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cosmeticos para la venta.
texts.en: Gregoria has been dedicated to selling food as well as ice cream, and catalog products for ten years and has been dedicated to the business selling breakfasts, lunches and spare parts and, in her business, she has at her disposition items like creams, lotions, deodorants, and shoes to take advantage of the visits of those who come to her business. At this time, she is requesting this loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos, es soltero, vive junto a sus padres, desde hace tres años se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas, lo aprendió de muy joven y se lo enseño su padre, por el momento no es un negocio difícil para administrarlo y es con esta actividad económica que apoya en los gastos de su casa y cubre sus gastos personales.
El capital que solicita lo utilizara para comprar abono, fertilizantes, pago de mozos y semillas, preparar el terreno, podara la maleza, ampliara el área de cultivo, espera tener una cosecha abundante y a tiempo para distribuirá a sus clientes con lo que sus ganancias las tendrá de inmediato y cumplirá con todos sus compromisos económicos.
Su visión es tener un negocio más rentable para que se autosuficiente y continuar dando la ayuda económica a sus padres.
texts.en:
Santos is single and lives with his parents. He has been farming produce for three years, which he learned to do at a young age, taught by his father. It is not currently a hard business to manage and it is with this economic activity that he helps support the expenses of his home and covers his personal expenses. 
He will use the capital he is requesting to buy feed, fertilizers and seeds, pay workers, prepare his land, trim weeds and expand the area being farmed. He hopes to have an abundant harvest, and a timely one, so he can distribute it to all of his clients and immediately procure his earnings in order to fulfill all of his economic commitments.
His vision is to have a more profitable business that becomes self-sufficient and to continue helping his parents economically.

loans.use: with the purchase of feed, fertilizers and seeds and payment of workers

loans.name: Aura Marina

texts.es: Doña Aura es madre de un pequeño varón de 3 años de edad, desde muy pequeña doña Aura aprendió la labor como bordadora, labor con la que ha seguido trabajando gracias a una maquina bordadora que su esposo le regalo, y también ahora logra atender una pequeña tienda de consumo diario el cual está ubicado en su domicilio, gracias a que su tienda se encuentra en la carretera principal de su localidad ella logra vender bastante bien, es por ello que ella ve la necesidad de comprar y surtir un poco mas su negocio, con los  siguientes productos, como arroz, azúcar, frijol, maíz, granillo, afrecho ( alimento para animales) jugos, gaseosa, pastas, cereales y verduras y  frutas. Doña Aura quiere seguir quedando bien con sus clientes que la visitan todos los días y es por ello que solicita de capital para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Aura has a three-year-old little boy. She learned embroidery when she was very young and she has continued to work thanks to an embroidering machine her husband gave her. She also currently runs a small grocery store located in her home. Since the store is on the main road in town she manages to make fairly good sales, which is why she believes she needs to invest a little more in her business in order to stock up on products like rice, sugar, beans, corn, small grains, bran (animal feed), juice, sodas, pasta, cereal, fruits, and vegetables. 

Aura wants to continue keeping her regular customers happy and is requesting this capital in order to keep working.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Alba Noemi

texts.es: Alba tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas de 16 años y 6 años de edad. Alba es una mujer emprendedora quien se dedica a la comercialización de productos de belleza y productos de consumo. Alba desea construir un baño sanitario, una fosa séptica, y repellar las paredes de un cuarto que se encuentran en mal estado. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, arena, cemento y hierro para proceder a la construcción del baño y a la mejora de las paredes del cuarto.
texts.en: Alba is 36 years old and lives in her own house along with her husband and their two daughters who are 16 and 6 years old. Alba is an entrepreneurial woman who is dedicated to selling beauty products and consumable products. Alba wishes to build a bathroom, a septic tank and to plaster the walls of a room that is in bad shape. For the above, she requests this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of brick, sand, cement and iron to proceed with the construction of the bathroom and improvement of the room's walls.

loans.use: to buy brick, sand, cement and iron to build a bathroom and to plaster the walls of a room.

loans.name: Amis Group

texts.fr:
Célestine est commerçante depuis 1990, dans le quartier TOKOIN en plein centre de Lomé capitale du Togo où elle vit avec son mari et ses 3 enfants. Elle est responsable du groupe "AMIS" composé de 10 personnes qui par la solidarité figurent tous sur la photo. Elle a su exploiter la devanture la maison pour y installer ses produits. Commerçante de maïs, elle achète et vend les charbons de bois lors de son approvisionnement en maïs sur le marché d’AGBELOUVE afin d’amortir le coût du transport. 
Les autre membres du groupe, achètent et vendent en gros et en détails des mèches,  des pagnes, des objets en plastiques et bien d’autre. 
Dans une même perspective, elles aimeraient par le crédit qu’elles sollicitent renforcer leur stock afin de maximiser sur le bénéficie en minimisant les coûts de transport.
texts.en: Celestine has been a vendor since 1990. She works in Tokoin, a very centrally located neighborhood in Lomé, the capital of Togo, where she lives with her husband and three children. She is the leader of the Amis ["friends"] group composed of 10 people, who, in the team spirit, are all featured in the photo. She is displaying her wares in front of her house. She sells corn and also buys charcoal while stocking up on corn at the Agbelou market in order to offset her transportation costs.

loans.use: to buy five bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Diferentes tipos de cosméticos que ofrece Flor María son los que nos abren las puertas a su pequeño negocio. Sus ventas han incrementado en los últimos meses ya que ha invertido en  otros  productos que  llamaron la atención de los consumidores.
Su esposo e hijo son un soporte fundamental en su negocio. Ellos se encargan de mostrar  los catálogos  que contienen toda la variedad de  productos de estas marcas. Solicita el crédito para la compra de: Cremas, Perfumes y Aretes de plata. Además de los cosméticos, Flor de María planea comercializar plata de buena calidad, es por eso que desea seguir trabajando con KIVA para que este proyecto se cumpla, de esta forma mejoran sus condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
The different types of cosmetics that Flor Maria offers are opening the doors of her small business. Her sales have increased in recent months since she has invested in other products that consumers notice.

Her husband and son are a fundamental source of support in her business. They are in charge of showing the catalogs that contain all the variety of products of these brands. She requests the loan to buy creams, perfumes and silver earrings. As well as the cosmetics, Flor de Maria plans to sell good quality silver. It is for this that she wishes to keep working with Kiva so this project is fulfilled and she improves her economic conditions.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes and silver earrings.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan to purchase gallons of kerosene for her business.

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of kerosene for her business

loans.name: José Pedro

texts.es:
Don Pedro un caballero de 30 años de edad, acompañado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar y al cuido de sus 2 pequeños hijos.
Don Pedro desempeña el cargo de vigilante(seguridad) en una localidad, pero en sus días libres, se dedica a la siembra de productos agrícolas (Maíz, Frijoles y pipianes).
Su esposa muy gustosamente después de la cosecha va a vender al mercado los productos que él ha logrado. Él ha aprendido a sobrellevar los 2 trabajos.
Don Pedro necesita el efectivo del préstamo para comenzar a preparar el terreno para la siembra de esta primavera. 
A futuro sueña con un negocio mas grande, ir ahorrando cada vez mas, incrementar sus ganancias y la vez seguir siendo el pilar de su familia.
texts.en:
Don Pedro is a 30 year old gentleman who lives with his wife, who does housework and cares for their 2 small children.

Don Pedro is a security watchman at a site, but on his days off he plants agricultural products (corn, beans and squash). His wife is very happy because after the harvest she will sell the produce he has grown at the market. Don Pedro has learned to cope with his two jobs. 

Don Pedro needs the money from the loan to start preparing the ground for planting this spring. He dreams of a future with a bigger business, to start saving more and more, and to increase profits while continuing to be the mainstay of his family.

loans.use: to prepare the ground for planting

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ma. Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a nipa-roofing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and a general store. Ma. Gina is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her nipa-roofing business.

Ma. Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her nipa-roofing business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, a 40-year-old married woman with four children, lives in Fort Portal. She owns a restaurant, along with farming for additional income. 

She has been in business for the last twenty years with an aim of supporting herself and the family at large. She faces a challenge of limited customers but has a vision of building a permanent residential house.

loans.use: to buy foods for the restaurant business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married mother of three children who attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 15,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase drugs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more onions, peppers, peanuts, bitter balls, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Karinda

texts.en:
Karinda is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in the coastal region of Kenya.

Karinda has operated a coconut selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours and passerby. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 41 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a restaurant, which she has been doing for seven years. She earns additional income from selling cassava flour. She faces a hardship of customers who do not pay her on time. 

Agnes is requesting a loan, which she will use o buy iron sheets for roofing her house. Her vision is to finish building her house.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets for roofing her house.

loans.name: Al- Abeer Al- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Abeer Al-Hodeidah. It is made up of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They are hardworking and enterprising women. They took a loan of 170,000 YER from AMB. 

Rim is the group's leader. She is 35 years old, married and has six children. One of Rim's goals is to continue to grow her business. Since she has professional experience in this field, she attracted more customers. This helped her husband to continue successfully running the business and made the business more profitable. She has started up as a dressmaker and sews clothing for the people in her area.  

She doesn't have enough money to improve her business. For this reason, she applied for a loan from AMB. She is using this loan to invest in her business by buying more sewing materials such as fabrics, zippers, buttons and other necessary materials. This loan will allow her to strengthen her business so that she can increase her revenue.

Rim hopes to earn large profits so that she can improve her savings in order to obtain a big loan and further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sewing materials.

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Rosaline is a 23-year-old single mother of two from Embu. She earns a living for her family by offering money transfer services. She has been in this business for the last year. She earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

Rosaline is requesting a loan from VisionFund Kenya in order to increase her business float. With the additional income she will earn from this improvement, she will reinvest in her business, support her mother and pay school fees for her children. 

In the future, Rosaline plans to continue to invest in her business and to eventually open more shops in other areas.

loans.use: to increase her business float for her money transfer business.

loans.name: Angelinah

texts.en:
Angelinah, a 40-year-old widowed mother of four from Mwingi, owns a business selling cereals. She has been selling cereals for the past ten years, with a monthly income of KES 6,000. She currently lacks the capital needed to purchase items in bulk to restock her store. 

With a loan through Visionfund Kenya, Angelinah will be able to purchase cereals in bulk. She will then be able to have a fully stocked store, which will attract more customers, generate sales, and create more profit. The additional income created will allow her to reinvest in her business, meet the needs of her family, and educate her youngest child, since the rest are grown-ups. 

In the future, Angelinah would like grow her business to a wholesale store.

loans.use: to purchase cereals in bulk.

loans.name: Medza

texts.en:
Medza is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

Besides the clothes selling business,she also operates a kiosk shop.

She is asking for a loan to buy wheat flour, milk, detergents, maize flour, and sugar for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, milk, detergents, maize flour, and sugar for her business

loans.name: Denis Alexander

texts.es:
Denis, invirtió el préstamo anterior en la adquisición de los insumos agrícolas necesarios para sembrar y tener buenos resultados en su negocio, tales como mayores ganancias, cosecha abundante, actualmente su familia se mantiene y se encuentra disfrutando de una vida más confortable.
Como la temporada de siembra se acerca Denis solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas y semilla, así de manera inmediata iniciará con los preparativos para seguir trabajando en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Denis invested his previous loan in purchasing the farming supplies he needed to plant and obtain good results from his business, like increased profit and an abundant harvest. He is currently able to support his family and they are enjoying a more comfortable life.

Since the planting season is approaching, Denis is requesting a new loan in order to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds. This will allow him to start all preparations immediately in order to continue farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.ru: Нуринисо милая и доброжелательная женщина из района Кубадиён, где она живет там вместе с мужем и детьми. Нуринисо по профессии учитель, но последние 2 года она занимается торговой деятельностью. У нее имеется магазин, где она вместе с мужем занимается там продажей продуктов питания. Нуринисо нуждается в кредите, чтобы увеличить разновидность продуктов в магазине и привлечь больше клиентов. Кредит поможет ей закупить больше товара и увеличить доход.
texts.en: Nuriniso is a friendly, kind woman from the Qubadiyon area and she lives there with her husband and children. She is a teacher by profession but has run a shop for the last two years. She and her husband sell grocery products. Nuriniso needs a loan in order to offer a wider variety of products in her store and to attract more customers. The loan will help her to purchase more goods and increase her revenue.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of food products for her grocery store

loans.name: Dzine

texts.en:
Dzine is a widowed woman with nine children, five of whom attend school and four of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, Dzine has operated a kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major business challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With this loan, Dzine wants to purchase rice, wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and sugar for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Leocadio

texts.es:
Don Locadio, un agricultor de 61 años de edad. Desde muy joven aprendió este labor el cual le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus 4 niños y apoyar a su esposa en los gastos del hogar. Él cada mañana emprende su trabajo con entusiasmo, sabe que es un medio de subsistencia que le permite llevar los alimentos diarios al hogar. Gracias al esfuerzo y a la dedicación tiene sus hijos ya grandes, el mayor tiene 21 años quien es el que le ayuda en su trabajo, cada día. Comienzan desde las 6.00 am de la mañana y terminan su jornada hasta las 12.00pm del mediodía. 

Don Leocadio utilizara el efectivo del préstamo para pagar el alquiler del terreno donde siembra sus semillas, ademas comprara fertilizantes para su cosecha, pesticidas para la plaga y abono. Este año se dedicara a sembrar Maíz, maicillo y frijol. 

Don Leocadio tiene planes a futuro, dice que espera seguir con muchas fuerzas para seguir sembrando, ayudando a su familia. Luchando juntamente con ellos a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Locadio is a 61 year old farmer. He learned this job from a very young age, which has allowed him to move his four children forward and support his wife with household expenses. 

Every morning, he begins his work with enthusiasm. He knows it us a means of subsistence that allows him to bring home food daily. His older children (the oldest is 21) helps him with his work everyday, thanks to his effort and dedication. They work starting at 6 a.m.and finish their working day at noon.

Leocadio will use the loan money to pay rent on the land where he plants his seeds. He will also buy fertilizers for his crops, pesticides for pests, and compost. This year, he is planting corn, millet and beans.

Leocadio has plans for the future. He says, with strength, he hopes to continue planting and helping his family, striving together with them to get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for rent of land, purchase of fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Dúo Elizabeth Group

texts.es: Dúo Elizabeth doña Maria líder de este grupo, se dedica a la actividad de venta de pollo de manera ambulante, lo cual realiza 2 veces por semana, y a mantener una pequeña venta de consumo diario, ubicado en su domicilio, doña Maria manifiesta que con su pareja tienen grandes sueños en poder construir una casa propia, esto es motivo para que ella siga luchando diariamente y aprovechar las oportunidad, por lo que cuando hay oportunidad también se dedica a la venta de huevos,en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la venta
texts.en:
Maria is the leader of the Dúo Elizabeth group. She works as a street vendor selling chicken, which she does twice a week, and running a small grocery store located in her home. Maria says that she and her partner have big dreams. They want to be able to build their own house, which is why she keeps fighting every day and making the most of every opportunity. She also sells eggs whenever she can. 

This time she is requesting a loan to buy groceries to sell.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Artemen

texts.en:
Artemen is literally poor. He wants to buy a concrete machine and he needs financial help for this. He believes that lenders will show compassion, as they always do, and lend to him.

Artemen is an Egyptian Albanian from one of the most vulnerable ethnic groups of Albania. He is 39 years old and a father of three children who are 17, 9, and 8 years old.  Artemen works in construction with a specialty in paving tiles and doing plaster work.  His wife works on an hourly basis in a tobacco factory in the city of Korce, where they reside. In their city and the surrounding area there are touristic places to visit such as the ‘Old Bazaar’ and other artistic places. Flour starch is produced in large quantities in this city and also there are snail farms in suburbia.

loans.use: to buy a concrete machine

loans.name: Cristo El Rey Group

texts.en:
Londanci is one of the members of the group called Cristo el Rey. The group consists of 15 micro-business people from San Pedro de Macoris, a batey (a company town) surrounded by sugarcane fields where they live and work. They are selling clothes, miscellaneous products, shoes, groceries, food, etc. 

Londaci is a Haitian woman who lives in a simple home with her long term partner.  She is associated with Esperanza, needing capital to invest in her clothing business, which she has been doing for two years. She requested her third loan from Esperanza Internacional, which she will use to purchase clothes, shoes, and other products. Londaci's most difficult challenge was to start her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Virgen De La Puerta Group
