texts.es: Milagros tiene 44 años de edad es casada con 02 hijos educando y uno en espera. Ella implemento su bodega en su vivienda en donde ofrece frutas verduras carne y abarrotes. Y a la vez vende productos de belleza y materiales de escritorio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas verduras frutas carnes abarrotes. En el grupo “VIRGEN DE LA PUERTA” cumple la función de tesorera. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Milagros es la primera del lado derecho  viste polo blanco. Y de la misma manera se encuentra adjuntada la foto de Anne en la parte superior derecho que no puedo estar presente en la reunión por atender su negocio.
texts.en:
Milagros is 44 years old and married. She is raising two children and is expecting her third. She set up a grocery store in her home, and there she sells fruits, vegetables, meat, and other groceries. She also sells beauty products and office supplies. She will invest this loan in buying more fruits, vegetables, meat, and other groceries. She is acts as treasurer of the group Virgen de la Puerta. 

The group wants to thank Kiva lenders for the loans they offer. Milagros is the first person from the right in the picture, wearing a white polo shirt. Anne's picture was was included in the upper right corner of the photo because she was working on her business and was unable to attend the meeting.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, vegetables, meat, and other groceries.

loans.name: Xiomara Abigail

texts.es: Xiomara tiene 40 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 13 años de edad dado que su esposo emigro al extranjero en busca de mejores condiciones de vida. Xiomara trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su hijo y mantener la economía del hogar. Desea hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y antojitos típicos. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito  a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pared que sirva de división dentro de su casa y así contar con mayor comodidad. Con el monto solicitado comprará ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro.
texts.en: Xiomara is forty years old and lives in her own home with her thirteen-year-old son, since her husband emigrated abroad looking for better living conditions. Xiomara works very hard in order to provide for her son and support her household. She has been working selling clothing, shoes, and traditional snacks for twenty years. In order to impove her housing situation, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in building a partition wall to divide the space in her home in order to live more comfortably. She will use the requested amount to buy bricks, cement, sand, and iron.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and iron to build a partition wall in her home.

loans.name: Tiraphan

texts.en:
Tiraphan is a Thai artisan who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of gemstones, waxed cords, and brass beads and bells. She would also like to hire another artisan to assist at her workshop.

Tiraphan has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is her story:

"I'm always trying to look my best by wearing nice dresses and jewelry. I believe many women think like me, and that's what inspired me to create jewelry that is original.

Thank you so much for this microcredit. I wish to increase my stock and I also want to craft the new designs I have in mind, and for that to happen I require a larger stock of materials. This would also make it easier for me to expand my workshop by hiring an assistant."

Use the link below to view Tiraphan's handcrafted jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6856

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of gemstones and other materials for her jewelry making

loans.name: M'balu

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old M'balu. She is married and has three children, aged 18,16, and 10 years old. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because she is her younger brother's daughter and M'balu needs to support her for schooling.  

In 2001, M'balu established her rice business. She began this business to help her provide the basic needs of her family. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business. 

M'balu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy more rice for her business. 

In the future, M'balu plans to support her children’s education up to university level and grow her business into a very large rice store, so that she can be selling wholesale to other businesses. Competition and rainy season are her big challenges. This business has helped her in raising her children. She is looking forward to funds that will help her in developing her business, so that she will save enough money for her children’s education.
 
M'balu thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rice for her business.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with five children all who go to school. She lives at her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanasiti has operated a kerosene selling business for the past two years. She cites transportation costs as her major business challenge.

With the loan she is requesting, Mwanasiti wants to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale.

loans.name: Manantial De Vida Group

texts.es: Manantial de vida Se conforma por doña Aureliana líder de este dúo, quien se dedica a la  elaboración y preparación de tamales, y chuchitos, ella por más de 5 años  se ha dedicado a esta actividad, con lo que ha logrado salir adelante con su esposo en los gastos del hogar, doña Aureliana ahora requiere de capital para compra de leña, maíz, tomates, especies para la preparación de tamales, manteca, carnes.  Ella ve  la necesidad, de seguir trabajando arduamente mientras cuente con vida pero su limitante es el capital,es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materiales para la elaboracion de tamales
texts.en: Manantial de Vida was founded by Aureliana, who is the leader of this duo. She works making and preparing tamales (wrapped in leaves) and chuchitos (wrapped in corn husks). She has been in business for over five years, and this has allowed her to help her husband with household expenses. Aureliana now needs capital in order to buy firewood, corn, tomatoes, and spices to make her tamales, as well as lard and meats. She feels she needs to keep working as long as there is life in her but her capital is limited. That is why she is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for making tamales.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make and sell tamales.

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, fish, pepper, oil, meat, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa, a 60-year-old married mother of five, has been earning a living farming bananas in the Philippines for 20 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Elisa is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: La Union 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Maribel is the coordinator of her group, La Union (the union). This group consists of 15 micro-entrepreneurs located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, where Maribel makes her home in a simple structure with her two children and long-term partner. Her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children. 

Maribel has sold clothing for around five years, having started the business with her own savings. Now retailing a variety of products, she is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza International, with which she will use to purchase clothes. Maribel will reinvest the profits in her enterprise and save some for any family needs that may arise. She also wants to save and have a beautiful and safe home. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes and other miscellaneous products

loans.name: Dúo Las Victorias Group

texts.es:
DUO LAS VICTORIA
El señor Vicente DE 55 años, casado,  desde hace 25 años posee una Polleria ubicada en el mercado municipal de el Tejar, Chimaltenango que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio el  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de don Vicente es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar mas pollo para seguir creciendo con su polleria.
texts.en:
Vicente is 55 years old and married. He has owned a poultry shop for the past 25 years. It is located in the local market in El Tejar, Chimaltenango. His effort allowed him to set up his business, which in turn has enabled him to provide for his family and improve his home.

Vicente's dream is to be able to improve his quality of life as well as his family's through this loan, which he is requesting from FAPE. He will use the loan to buy more chicken, so that his business can continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy chicken to sell.

loans.name: Cereza

texts.en:
Cereza, a 38-year-old married mother of three, works hard to provide for her family.  She has been running a general store in the Philippines for two years, and also earns an income from food vending.

Cereza, who has borrowed and repaid three previous loans from NWTF, has requested a new one for PHP 10000 to buy additional stocks such as snack foods, soft-drinks, candies, biscuits, detergent, shampoo, etc. to sell. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like snack foods, soft-drinks, candies, biscuits, detergent, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Evelyn works hard to support her family. She sells charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns income from a general store.  

Evelyn, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF, has requested a new one for PHP 11000 to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nelfie

texts.en:
Nelfie is 38 years old, married, and has five children who attend school. She is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. 

Nelfie requested her sixth loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase vitamins, feeds, and other supplies for her livestock. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, feeds, and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rhodora is 36 years old.

Rhodora has a business making native bags in the Philippines. Rhodora requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her business. Rhodora has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rhodora would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for making native bags

loans.name: Ma. Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ma. Helen works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and motorcycle transport.

Ma. Helen is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business. Ma. Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nestora Maria

texts.en:
Nestora Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a livestock raising business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years and earns additional income from nipa (palm thatch) roofing and handicraft making.

Nestora Maria is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. Nestora Maria dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years and she earns additional income from pig fattening.

Arsenia is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. Arsenia dreams of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Yanet Marisol

texts.es: Yanet tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 15 años, 14 años y 5 años de edad. Yanet se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace dos años y es así como junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Yanet desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia por lo que ha tomado la decisión de encementar el piso de la vivienda y de instalar  la energía eléctrica ya que no cuenta con el servicio. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, grava y para pagar por la instalación del servicio de energía eléctrica en su vivienda que tanta falta le hace.
texts.en: Yanet is 36 and lives in her own house with her partner and their three children aged 15, 14 and 5. Yanet has worked providing domestic services for two years and this is how, together with her partner, they make a living to cover their household costs. Yanet wants to improve her living conditions and those of her family, which is why she has taken the decision to cement the floor in her house and install electricity, as they are not connected to the supply. This is why she is asking for a loan through FUSAI:  to invest in buying cement, sand and gravel, as well as to pay for the installation of electricity in her home, which she needs greatly.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to cement her floor, as well as paying for the installation of electricity.

loans.name: Aizada

texts.ru: Айзаде 33 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Айзады - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айзада занимается животноводством, стартовав 16 лет назад с 4,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Айзады в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова,а также парник, где выращивает помидоры, перец, огурцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сомов (KGS). Айзада входит в группу "Ынтымак 1", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. В итоге их трое. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айзада обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом на покупку минеральных удобрений, семян элитных сортов и клеенки для парника. Доходы от кредита Айзада планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса, также она хочет накопить средства на покупку автомобиля.
texts.en: Aizada is 33, married, and has four children. She has a high school education and earns her family's main income by raising livestock, which she began 16 years ago with 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Aizada now has one dairy cow along with a greenhouse where she plants tomatoes, peppers, and cucumbers. She earns 11,000 som (KGS) per month. Aizada is in the group Yntymak 1, which includes two other people for a total of three members. In order to expand her farm, Aizada applied for a loan with the bank Bai-Tushum to purchase fertilizers, high-quality seeds and oilcloth for the greenhouse. She plans to use the profits to continue expanding her farm and to save enough money to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Dúo La Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
DUO LA PROSPERIDAD
La  señora Blanca Orquidea de 52 años, soltera,  desde hace 8 años posee una Tienda ubicada en LA Colonia el Sococbal, Chimaltenango que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de doña Blanca es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar más productos de consumo diario para seguir creciendo con su tienda.
texts.en:
Duo La Prosperidad

Blanca Orquidea is 52 years old and single. For eight years, she has had a store located in the Sococbal neighborhood of Chimaltenango. Through her efforts she managed to set it up and to improve her home. Through her business she has managed to support her family and help them move forward in life.

Blanca's dream is to be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family through the loan she is requesting from FAPE. With the loan, she wants to buy more basic household products so that she can continue expanding her store.

loans.use: To buy basic household products to sell.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is 45 years old and married with three children, who are currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Sherlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store.

Sherlita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, shampoo, detergent, soap, cooking oil, biscuits, snack foods, etc. 

In the future, Sherlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.en:
Anselmo, age 55, is a certified organic cacao farmer of MMC. He and his wife Valentina raised their 10 children together and all are living out. They both live happily in the beautiful village of San Jose. Anselmo manages his acres of mature cacao trees.

Anselmo got inspired to plant cacao trees with assistance given from a local association. He sees the importance of planting cacao not only as a source of income, but also beautifying the environment by protecting the forest from deforestation. He enjoys all the farm work he is doing in both cacao farming and planting other farm crops like corn and beans. He enjoys pruning his cacao as well as maintaining the trees to be productive. He is also a retiree from the teaching profession. 

Anselmo is requesting this loan to hire helpers to clean his cacao farm. 

Anslemo stated that it is very difficult to get a farmer's loan form other institutes and banks. His previous loans really assisted him in doing numerous work on the farm.

loans.use: To hire laborers to clean his acre of cacao trees

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 40 years old and married with three children, who are currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Juanita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries, such as eggs, bread, cooking oil, noodles, milk, coffee, etc., to sell.

Juanita has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items, such as eggs, bread, cooking oil, noodles, milk, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Juanita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries, such as eggs, bread, cooking oil, noodles, milk, coffee, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 42 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Mila is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mila has been in pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from food vending and a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es:
Rosa, ha tenido que ejercer sola la responsabilidad de salir a delante con dos hijas, las cuales actualmente tienen 23 y 21 años, el hecho de ser madre soltera la impulso a buscar la forma de tener ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, es así como realiza la apertura de un comedor en el que ofrece diferentes menús y una buena atención a sus clientes.
Invertirá en surtir el inventario de su negocio con todos los materiales necesarios para elaborar la comida y mantener su negocio funcionando, comprara verduras, arroz, frijol, aceite, carnes, embutidos, pastas, condimentos, bebidas, espera aumentar la calidad de su servicio, atraer nuevos clientes y aumentar sus ingresos.
Su sueño es tener un local con mejores instalaciones y cumplir con los compromisos familiares.
texts.en:
Rosa has had sole responsibility of successfully raising her two daughters, who are currently 23 and 21 years old. Being a single mother has prompted her to find sources of income to cover family expenses, which is what caused her to open a small restaurant offering different menus and good customer service.

She will invest in stocking inventory for her business, including all the materials needed to prepare food and keep her business running (buy vegetables, rice, beans, oil, meat, sausages, pasta, condiments, drinks). She aims to increase the quality of her service, attract new customers and increase revenue. Her dream is to have a restaurant with better facilities and to meet her family commitments.

loans.use: to buy buy vegetables, rice, beans, oil, meat, sausages, pasta, condiments, and drinks

loans.name: Lucio

texts.en:
Lucio, age 28, is a certified organic cacao farmer of MMC. He lives in the beautiful village of San Jose. He, together with his wife Leticia, is raising their daughter to become well educated or become a farmer. His wife spends most of her time at the farm with him, cleaning and harvesting cacao pods.

Lucio is an inspired young cacao farmer. He became motivated to plant and manage his 600 mature cacao trees. He presently started his own nursery of 3,000 cacao seedlings, which he will plant in June.  He said when he started with his acre of cacao, he was not really interested in cacao farming. Once he started to see production and a market available at his door to purchase cacao from farm to scale, he get more excited. Apart from farming cacao, he also cultivates vegetables, corn, beans and rice. Farming is a source of income for his family.

Lucio is requesting this loan to hire a worker to assist him in cleaning and under brushing to plant his 3,000 new seedlings. Under brushing is the way to have the trails to plant the new seedlings.

His future envisions expanding his cacao farming and reaping benefits later for his betterment of his livelihood and his daughter.

loans.use: To clean and under brush his cacao trees

loans.name: La Fuente De Bendicion 1 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is one of the members of the group called La Fuente de Bendicion 1. She works selling food. She cooks it to sell daily for lunch to people working in her area. This is called a comedor (neighborhood small restaurant). She runs it in her community, which is a rural area surrounded by forests and mountains. Carmen started her business around 10 years ago with her personal savings. She sells creole and homemade plates like rice, beans, chicken, etc. 

Carmen lives near Bahia, in the town of Hato Mayor, an agricultural zone. She has four children and lives with her long-term partner. Her most important challenge is to have a successful restaurant. Carmen is requesting her eighth loan from Esperanza International. Because her loan repayments have all been made punctually, she has been able to grow her business with the re-investment from each loan. She has had the opportunity to improve her life and family and expand her business to get more clients.

Carmen would like to save her profits to finish building her house and give her family some economic changes for the future. In the future, she wants to have a successful business. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, meat, cooking oil, and more.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel tiene 37 años, vive en el distrito de Santiago; Ica y es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, sobre todo porque es madre de 2 hijos de 11 y 8 años de edad. Ysabel trabaja como asistente contable y con los ingresos de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Ysabel esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar útiles escolares para sus hijos, con lo cual podrá asistir de manera adecuada a la escuela y contar con los materiales necesarios y Ysabel podrá seguir esforzándose para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Ysabel is 37 and lives in Santiago district in the province of Ica. She is a woman with a great desire to get on in life, especially as she is the mother of two children aged 11 and 8. Ysabel works as an assistant accountant, and with the income from her job she covers the household costs.

Ysabel is grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, she will be able to buy school supplies for her children. This will help them go to school with all the correct materials. Ysabel will be able to continue pushing to make her great dream a reality: to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Dúo Rosas De San Juan Group

texts.es:
Dúo Rosas de San Juan
Doña Magdalena tiene ya 10 años en la vena de consumo diario, a su pequeño negocio le ha agregado la venta de regalos, para toda ocasión, también  logra la venta de choco frutas, y en la hora que los niños pasan a  su  jornada de estudio ella vende frutas,  en bolsa, chocos, gelatinas, helados, tostadas etc. A Dios gracias a logrado mantener su negocio y siempre estando al pendiente de sus dos hijos,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la venta
texts.en:
The "Rosas de San Juan" Dup

Magdalena has been working for ten years selling consumable goods. She now also sells gifts for all occasions, as well as fruit chocolates and, when children come by during school breaks, Magdalena sells bags of fruits, chocolates, jelly, ice creams, and more. Thanks to God, Magdalena has managed to keep her business going and she is always looking out for her two children. Magdalena is applying for this loan in order to buy consumable goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy consumable goods to sell.

loans.name: Dinora Eloísa

texts.es:
La Joven Dinora Eloísa habita en el municipio de santa Rosa del peñón departamento de león, una ciudad donde los pobladores son trabajadores y buscan la forma cómo sobrevivir en mejores condiciones.  

Dinora  es un joven de 25 años de edad Casada, no tiene hijos a su cargo, de profesión y oficio enfermera labora en uno de los centro del estado, su esposo de igual forma se gana su vida laborando en uno de los centro del estado, comenta que se sienten a gusto con este tipo de empleo.

 Son de sus sueños llegar a obtener mejores condiciones en su propia vivienda, esta es su cuarta solicitud de crédito realizada a Ceprodel y Kiva para que estos le brinden un nuevo financiamiento, para la compra de: Ladrillo, Cemento y Arena, esto le sería de gran beneficio para ir construyendo mejor su vivienda. 

Agradece con el apoyo que Ceprodel y Kiva le ha brindado y espera en Dios seguir recibiendo este privilegio, donde a través de kiva y Ceprodel le van cumpliendo sus sueños de tener una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Dinora Eloísa lives in Santa Rosa municipality in the León department. In Santa Rosa the people are hard-working and looking for a way to live under better conditions.

Dinora is 25 years old and married. She does not have children. She works as a nurse at a local state health centre. Her husband also works in a state centre. Dinora tells us that the couple like their jobs.

Dinora's dreams are to improve her living conditions. This is her fourth loan with "Ceprodel" and Kiva. She is applying for another loan in order to buy bricks, cement and sand. This would be of great help to Dinora so that she can build a better home.

Dinora is grateful for the support provided by "Ceprodel" and Kiva, and she trusts in God that she will continue to receive this privilege. Through "Ceprodel" and Kiva, Dinora is achieving her dream of having a better home.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and sand.

loans.name: Mizrobi

texts.ru: Мизроби является поваром-шашлычником из района Кубадиён. Ему 23 года. Он еще не женат и живет с родителями. Мизроби год назад открыл свою шашлычную. В ней работают он сам, его сестра и еще трое официанток. Его шашлычная славится вкусно приготовленными шашлыками и у них всегда много посетителей. Мизроби очень энергичный, позитивный и целеустремленный молодой человек. Он просит кредит для расширения своего дела. Мизроби хочет купить большой холодильник для хранения мяса, а также большую мясорубку для приготовления фарша для своих шашлыков. У Мизроби большие планы на будущее и он уже сейчас стремится к реализации своих планов -  главное из которых расширения своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Mizrobi is a kebab cook from the Qubadiyon district.  He is 23 years old.  He is not yet married and lives with his parents.  Mizrobi opened his kebab cafe a year ago.  He, his sister and three waitresses work there.  His cafe is known for delicious kebabs and always has many customers.  Mizrobi is a very energetic, positive and driven young person.  He is requesting this loan to expand his business.  Mizrobi wants to purchase a large refrigerator for storing meat and also a big meat grinder for preparing ground meat for his kebabs.  Mizrobi has big plans for the future and already tries to realize them - the main one of which is expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase a large refrigerator for storing meat and also a meat grinder

loans.name: Mope

texts.en:
Mope is 48 years old and married with two children.

Mope works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, cereals, sugar, soft drinks, juice, biscuits, bread, etc., to sell.

Mope has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Mope aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, cereals, sugar, soft drinks, juice, biscuits, bread, etc., to sell

loans.name: Wilvie

texts.en:
Wilvie is 54 years old and married with one child.

Wilvie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Wilvie has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Wilvie aspires to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 48 years old and married with eight children. With four children in school, Zosima works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Zosima has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Martina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Martina is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell for her buy-and-sell vegetable business.

Martina has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Murotkul

texts.ru:
Муроткул добродушный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 44 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Со своей семьёй Муроткуд живёт в сельском посёлке. Для того, чтобы иметь доход на проживание он занимается своим бизнесом. Вот уже на протяжении  нескольких лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультуру, сеет картофель, а также садоводством. Затем, когда собирает урожай, вывозит на большой базар и там продаёт свой урожай. Раньше он занимался деканством и потом решил реализовывать свой урожай. 

Муроткул сотрудничает с Арванд с 2013 года и является добросовестным клиентом. От своего бизнеса Муроткул получает хороший доход, который тратит на удовлетворение нужд своей семьи.  Но сейчас он хочет расширить бизнес, именно по выращиванию картофеля. И сейчас у него недостаточно собственных денежных средств, чтобы закупить семена для посева картофеля.  Поэтому Муроткул обратился в Арванд и хочет взять кредит для закупа семян для посева. Он очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Murotkul is a kind and hardworking 44 year-old man.  He is married and has three children.  Murotkul lives with his family in a rural village.  He is involved in his own business to provide an income for living.  He has been involved in growing agricultural crops, planting potatoes and gardening for several years.  Then, he gathers his harvest, takes it to a large market and sells it there.  He was previously involved in organized farming and then decided to sells his own harvest.  

Murotkul has been partnering with Arvand since 2013 and is a conscientious client.  Murotkul earns a good income from his business and spends it for meeting his family needs. But now he wants to expand his business, specifically the potato-growing business.  And now he does not have enough of his own money to purchase seeds for planting potatoes.  This is why Murotkul came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy seeds for sowing.  He hopes very much for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for support.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 60 years old, married, and has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Liza has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns income from selling vegetables.

Liza aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes, candy, biscuits, soft drinks, and other items to resell.

loans.name: Bessi Xiomara

texts.es: Bessi tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 14 años, 11 años y 8 años de edad. Bessi se dedica  a la venta de tortillas desde hace un año aproximadamente. Cuenta con experiencia y muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Ella desea construir una pila con baño e instalar la energía eléctrica dado que no cuenta con el servicio. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro e instalación de la energía eléctrica. De esta forma espera dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Bessi is 32 years old and lives in her own house with her partner and three children, who are aged 14, 11 and 8 years old respectively. Bessi has been making a living selling tortillas for about a year. She has experience and many customers, who every day prefer her tortillas over others'. 

Bessi would like to build a sink and bathroom, and install electricity in her house. To do this, she is applying for a loan from "FUSAI", which she will invest in bricks, cements, sand, iron and installing electricity. By doing this Bessi hopes to offer her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron and to install electricity.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 39 years old and a resident of Lower Salug Daku, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with two kids who are school age. She earns a living through tricycle franchising.

She has been a member of PMPC since 2012 and has been enjoying the privileges of being a member.

Now she is applying for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy an additional motorcycle for her transportation business.

She hopes to maintain her good membership with the cooperative

loans.use: To buy an additional motorcycle for her  transportation business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 48 years old and married with four children. 

Lolita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lolita has been farming rice for five years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Hermojenia

texts.en:
Hermojenia is 48 years old and married with 10 children, four of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like sugar, eggs, soap, shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell.

Hermojenia has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming coconuts.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like sugar, eggs, soap, shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is 52 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Hilda is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Hilda has been pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from retailing charcoal and farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marissa has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from raising livestock.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Magalis Del Socorro

texts.es:
Son las 6 pm, el olor del pollo asado, el sonido del aceite rebotando sobre el queso frito y el gallopinto recién hecho, nos recibe en su negocio de fritanga Magalis, una joven ejemplar de tan solo 25 años de edad y madre de un hermoso niño.
Mientras el carbón con el fuego se fusionan, Magali se prepara para un día más vendiendo su comida como toda una chef. El increíble sabor del gallopinto medio tostado, las tajadas de plátano crujientes y la carne asada en su punto, hacen de la fritanga todo un éxito, de manera que, junto con su hermana y el entusiasmo exponiéndose por sus poros, quiere seguir creciendo profesionalmente. Solicita el préstamo para comprar: Aceite, Azúcar, Harina, entre otras cosas para seguir produciendo, incrementar sus ventas, mejorar su producto, reparar sus casa y mantener activo el negocio.
texts.en:
At 6 p.m. the aroma of roast chicken and of freshly-made "gallopinto" (a local delicacy), and the sound of oil crashing on the fried chicken greets customers as they are met by Magalis, an exemplary young woman of just 25 years old, and a mother to a beautiful boy.

While the charcoal and fire come together, Magalis is preparing, like any chef, her food to sell for the day. The incredible flavour of the semi-prepared "gallopinto", the raw plantain slices, and the rare roasted meats are what makes Magalis' food so successful.With enthusiasm oozing through their pores, Magalis and her sister want to keep on growing as professionals. Magalis is applying for this loan in order to buy oil, sugar, flour and other goods to continue making her foods, to increase her sales, to improve her products, to fix her house and to keep her business going.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, flour and other items.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net and maintenance for her fishing boat.

Leonila has been in this business for 38 years now.

In the future, Leonila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net and maintenance for her fishing boat

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly is 41 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Melly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Melly has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, beers, soft drinks, cooking oil, candies, sugar, coffee, juice, etc. 

In the future, Melly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maurecia

texts.en:
Maurecia is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maurecia is 47 years old and has one child in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Maurecia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Maurecia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Maurecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 33 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming corn and cassava in the Philippines. Cristina is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Cristina has been in this business for three years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Olimkul

texts.ru:
Олимкул жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 52 лет. Он живёт вместе со своей  женой в собственном доме в маленьком кишлаке. Олимкул имеет среднее образование, его дети давно создали свои семьи, поэтому Олимкул заботится только о своей жене. Он много работает, чтобы они жили достойно и ни  в чём не нуждались,  а также чтобы иметь возможность помогать своим детям.

Олимкул сам является парикмахером, за 30 лет своей деятельности он успел изучить все тонкости своего дела и воспитать ряд учеников.  В связи  с возрастом и здоровьем сейчас он не может  много работать, поэтому он занялся скотоводством. Дома  у него имеются 2 коровы, за которыми они в месте с женой присматривают. Они также  решили купить несколько барашек для откорма, чтобы в дальнейшем получить от них доход. Сейчас Олимкул обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Olimkul is a happy 52 year-old man.  He lives with his wife in their own house in a small village.  Olimkul has a secondary education.  His children have had their own families for a long time, and this is why Olimkul only takes care of his wife.  He works a lot, so that they can live decently and have no needs, and also to be able to help their children.

Olimkul is a barber and was able to learn all of the nuances of his business and train several students during his 30 year career.  Due to his age and health, he cannot work so much anymore and this is why he got involved in animal husbandry.  He has two cows at home that he and his wife look after.  They also decided to buy several rams for fattening up in order to obtain a future income for them.  Now Olimkul came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy livestock.  He thanks Arvand in advance for support.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. Melanie is married and has a business making dried fish in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to dry.

Melanie has been in this business for 11 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Melanie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to dry

loans.name: Yenni Jamioy

texts.es:
Una niña llamada yenni  desde muy pequeña ha soñado con ser enfermera ya que en la niñez  ella salía del colegio para la casa pero pasando la calle se encontró con un accidente en el cual ella se acercó y se dio cuenta que la persona que estaba accidentada era la hermana, ella reacciono, hizo todo lo que estuvo al alcance para salvarla y logro estabilizarla mientras llegaba la ambulancia y desde ahí se dio cuenta que si servía para ser una enfermera, fue pasando el  tiempo ella como vivía fuera de bogota se fue a vivir con las tías en Bogotá, se puso a trabajar en un restaurante de mesera y en los ratos libres buscaba opciones para poder estudiar en enfermería ya que eso era lo que la apasionaba.      

Paso un tiempo  se dirigió a  varios institutos para recibir información, desde todos los que visito y se informó el que más le agrado fue campo alto se acercó al instituto  y a los pocos días se matriculo en una especialización de auxiliar de enfermería en horas de la mañana.
Actualmente esta en  segundo semestre, sale  y se dirige al trabajo, allí trabaja medio tiempo de ahí se dirige a la casa para hacer lo que le quedo pendiente en clase y le colabora a la tía. 
Ella quiere seguir estudiando, pero siente que los recursos económicos no le alcanzan y ve que el sueño no se le va hacer realidad, pero ella ara todo lo que este al alcance para poder seguir estudiando, en este caso ella se entero del convenio con kiva y le pareció una ayuda grande, ya que como dijo antes ella siente que a veces los gastos se incrementan bastante y no quiere dejar de estudiar, con este convenio ella puede graduarse y poner en práctica todos los conocimientos y ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
From the time she was very small, a girl named Yenni dreamed of being a nurse. In her childhood, she was leaving school to go home, but when she got to the street, she came upon an accident. She approached and realized that the person who had been injured was her sister. She reacted, did everything she could to save her, and managed to stabilize her while the ambulance arrived. Ever since then, she knew that she had what it took to be a nurse. Time passed; she went to live with her aunts in Bogotá, as she had been living outside of the city. There, she went to work as a server in a restaurant. In her free time, she searched for options for studying nursing, since that was her passion.

Soon after, she visited various institutions to gather information. Out of all those that she visited and learned about, the one that appealed to her most was Campo Alto. She approached the institution and, a few days later, she enrolled in a morning program to become a nursing assistant.   

Currently, she is in her second semester. When she gets out, she heads to work. There, she works part-time and then goes home to do her schoolwork and to help her aunt. 

She wants to stay in school, but she feels that her financial resources are insufficient. She sees that her dream might not come true for her, but she will do everything within her reach to keep studying. 

Then, she found out about the arrangement with Kiva. It seemed like a big help to her; as she said before, she feels at times that the costs are really increasing, and she doesn't want to quit school. With this arrangement, she can graduate and put into practice all her knowledge and help others.

loans.use: to pay tuition for one semester.

loans.name: Zaropat

texts.ru:
Заропат  позитивная и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 59 лет. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. Так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Сразу после окончания средней школы Заропат выдали замуж. И так она стала домохозяйкой. Но, даже находясь постоянно  дома,  она никогда не сидит без дела. 

Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Заропат вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Она выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Заропат получает хороший доход. Их дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Заропат с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Заропат заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Zaropat is a positive and hardworking 59 year-old woman.  She is married and has two children.  She lives in a small rural village.  Circumstances occurred so that she could not obtain a higher education due to her family's financial needs.  Zaropat was married off right after she finished a secondary school.  And so she became a housewife, but even though she is always at home, she never sits without anything to do. 

To have a consistent income for food, Zaropat and her husband started their own business.  They are involved in animal husbandry.  She raises livestock and then sells meat and milk.  Zaropat earns a good income from this business.  Their income is sufficient to live at the middle class level.  And they still do not have enough means to cover all of the existing needs.  At the present time, Zaropat and her husband want to buy several heads of livestock for fattening up.  This is why she came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy livestock.  Zaropat thanks Arvand in advance for the support, due to which her family quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Narcisa works hard to support her family.

She has an ambulant vending vegetable and spices business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock and a general store.  Narcisa is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell for her ambulant vending vegetable and spices business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Narcisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Inom

texts.ru:
Ином жизнерадостный и ответственный мужчина в возрасте 55 лет. Он родился и живёт в небольшом посёлке. Живёт он со своей женой и тремя детьми в небольшом доме, который недавно построил. Сам Ином очень много работает, он является председателем Дехканского хозяйства в своём посёлке. Он очень уважаемый человек. Для своей семьи делает всё возможное, чтобы они жили в достатке и ни в чём не нуждались. 

Ином вот уже с 2012 года сотрудничает с Арванд. Он впервые брал кредит на потребительские нужды. Вот и сейчас также обратился для получения кредита на потребительскую нужду. Сейчас Ином обустраивает свой дом, в котором они живут, чтобы его детям и внукам было комфортно там жить. Он хочет закупить комфортную мебель в дом. Но у него сейчас не достаточно средств, чтобы закупить сразу всю мебель по оптовой цене. Поэтому Ином обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку мебели. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Inom is a happy and responsible 55 year-old man.  He was born and lives in a small village.  He lives with his wife and three children in a small house that he recently built.  Inom works a lot.  He is a leader of a dekhan farm in his village.  He is a very respected person.  He does everything possible for his family, so that they could live in abundance and not in need.  

Inom has been partnering with Arvand since 2012.  His first loan was for consumer needs.  And now he is also requesting a loan for consumer needs.  Inom is currently furnishing his house so that his children and grandchildren could live there comfortably.  He wants to purchase comfortable furniture for the house, but does not have enough money to buy all of the furniture at once at a wholesale price.  This is why Inom came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy furniture.  He thanks Arvand in advance for the support and hopes for a positive result.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Rosy

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rosy works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending and a buy and sell charcoal business. Rosy is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Rosy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 51 years old and a resident of Lower Salug Daku, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur Philippines. She earns a living through farming. Eva was attracted to the various programs and services of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She signed up for membership and enjoys the benefits of being a member in good standing. She applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparation. 

Eva hopes to live a comfortable life with enough savings in times of emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 59 years old and lives in Navalan, Pagadian. She is married with 7 children.

To earn a living, Carmen has a business raising ducks. She earns about 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of business. Carmen has requested a loan for her duck-raising business.  

Carmen has been a member of PMPC for six (6) years. In the future, Carmen would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ducks for sale.

location.town: Pagadian - Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is married with 1 child. She is 35 years old and lives in Balangasan Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur Philippines.

Perlita buys junk. She sells it to a big junk shop. She has had this business for 5 years. Each month she earns PHP 10,000 with this business. She requested a loan for additional capital for her business.

Perlita has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to build a big junk shop store.

loans.use: to buy junk.

location.town: Pagadian - Balangasan District, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Daphne

texts.en:
Daphne is 67 years old. She is very responsible with her household obligations and has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her two children. She is a farmer who plants coconut and eggplant.

Daphne wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

location.town: Tangub-P4 Digson, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, M

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma previously accessed an 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Vilma hopes to have her own stall for her junk shop and dreams that her family is always in good health. Each week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business. There she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 34 years old, married and lives at Dopol Bagumbang Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from the neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending on their agreement. With a desire to earn more, Joan decided to raise pigs on her own as well.
 
Through PMPC, Joan obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to purchase piglets

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rebecca is 54 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Rebecca has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her livestock.

Rebecca has been in this business for 10 years. Rebecca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en: Saret, 32, is a married mother of one dependent son who is under-aged for schooling. She lives in Battambang province where her four hectare of paddy rice has grown as the main source of her income. The five years engagement in her current business has generated her about 38,000 KHR per day. This is the second loan for Saret and the first loan for her joint borrower in the same group of two with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Saret is the group leader. She is seeking for 1,200,000 KHR while her co-borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for reaping and plowing fees and purchase fertilizer. She hopes her standard of living will improve.

loans.use: to pay for reaping and plowing fees and purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en:
Nelinda works hard to support her family. Nelinda is married and has a buy and sell banana fruits business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.

Nelinda has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Nelinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Turonbibi

texts.ru:
Туронбиби 48-летняя замужняя женщина, занимающаяся своим любимым делом. Она швея и принимает заказы на пошив женских платьев национального покроя. Этой деятельностью Туронбиби занимается в течение 10 лет. За эти годы она накопила большой опыт в своей профессии и знает все тонкости шитья.
Туронбиби замужем и имеет троих детей. Ее муж в данный момент работает за пределами страны. Туронбиби живет с детьми в столице в городе Душанбе. Она сама следит за воспитанием детей и серьезное значение отдает их учебе.
Сейчас Туронбиби обратилась в организацию за кредитом. Она хочет купить новую швейную машинку и расширить свою деятельность. Она нуждается в этом кредите.
texts.en: Turonbibi is a 48 -year-old married woman, who makes a living doing her favorite thing. She is a seamstress and makes traditional cultural dresses to order. Turonbibi has been a seamstress for 10 years. Over the years, she has accumulated a lot of experience in the profession and knows all the intricacies of sewing. Turonbibi is married and has three children. Her husband is currently working abroad. Turonbibi lives with her children in the capital city of Dushanbe. She monitors her children's education and places great importance on their studies. Now, Turonbibi has turned to the organization for a loan. She wants to purchase a new sewing machine and expand her business. She needs this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 20 years old, single and lives in Migpange Bonifacio. 
He has a requested a loan to pay for his tuition and other school fees. 
Robert has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Robert hopes to become a successful policeman.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her loan also helped in their everyday household expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their family.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marina hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams of having a better living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Emma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en: Sina is a rural villager from Battambang province and a mother of four children, three in school. To support the family, she does rice farming as the main source of income which she has involved in for 15 years. This business has generated about 31,600 KHR in income per day. She is a previous borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); She has utilized her past loan to improve her lifestyle. Now, she leads a group of five members with the total requested loan amount of 7,000,000 KHR. Sina's loan portion is 1,400,000 KHR which she will spend on insecticide and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that her business will enable her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy insecticide and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him. He was able to buy more products for his variety store. It helped not just in his business but also in meeting his family's every day household needs. He and his wife are working hard to provide for their family. He is also a fruit dealer to earn additional income.
 
He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Ronald dreams that his business will continue to expand and hopes to have a better future. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  There he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Rudily

texts.en:
Rudily is 20 years old and lives in Migpange, Bonifacio. She is single. She has a requested a loan to  pay for her tuition and other school fees.

Rudily has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to become a successful policewoman.

loans.use: pay  for tuition fee

loans.name: Siiti Hawa

texts.en:
Siiti Hawa is 47 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Siiti Hawa has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending, from her general store, and from raising cattle and farming coconut.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
A 31-year-old mother of two children and a villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sokhom is a farmer who does rice farming as her main source of income. She has been involved with this business for 15 years and she can earn 31,600 KHR per day.  This is the eighth-cycle loan for Sokhom and the third cycle for her joint borrower in the same group consisting of two with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

The past loan, which Sokhom has repaid, enabled her to improve her lifestyle and make it better than before. Now, she is seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. She is the group leader and she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide and to pay the plowing fee. She hopes to uplift her living conditions and make her life better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide and to pay plowing fee

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en: Tha is a 45-year-old citizen from Battambang province and the mother of six children. Rice farming is her main source of income to support the family and she has been farming for about 15 years. She has been earning 23,300 KHR per day. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for years and it has improved her living conditions. She plans to fully pay back the loan, her seventh, while her co-borrower is on her fifth loan. Tha is seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR and her co-borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion on fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee for her rice crop. She strongly hopes that she can make more income so that she can live a better life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay plowing fee for her rice crop

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza, 59, is married with three adult-age children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 20 years. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. She is continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Virginia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Virginia is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco de 77 años de edad, es una persona muy amable y servicial, él se creció con sus padres que se dedicaban al destazo de cerdos, Francisco se dedicaba a ayudar en las tareas agrícolas y al destazo por la mañana con sus padres y por las tardes se dedicaba a estudiar en el centro escolar de su comunidad, él estudio hasta  6° grado, el motivo por el cual no continuo sus estudios fue por que a medida adquirió conocimientos y experiencias decidió dedicarse a la compra y venta de cerdos él es unos de los hermanos mayores a los cuales les tocaba trabajar la agricultura para llevar el sustento diario a la familia.

Francisco trabaja en la agricultura y también en la compra de cerdos, estos los compra y los engorda; en algunas ocasiones los compra los días viernes de tiangue para después venderlos a personas que trabajan la carnicería, esto lo aprendió de un amigo que le enseño también trabaja en la agricultura, en la siembra del maíz; que parte de las cosechas las utiliza para el consumo y otra para la alimentación de los animales.
Él tiene que recorrer varios kilómetros para comprar los cerdos,  ya que él visita casa por casa o los compra los días de tiangue  municipal.

El dinero sera utilizado para comprar cerdos, ya que tiene un espacio preparado en la casa donde cuidara y alimentara a los animales hasta que ya estén aptos para la venta. De esta manera, tendrá mejores ganancias económicas las cuales serán invertidas en mejoramiento de su casa, pues manifiesta que pretende construir una habitación para su nieto.                                                                                                                                                 

Las proyecciones que tiene a futuro  Francisco, son las de tener una galera mas grande que le permita criar mas cerdos, también, con ayuda de un nuevo crédito comenzara a dar forma a un estanque de peses y también apoyar en la educación de sus nietos.
texts.en:
Francisco is 77 years old, and is a very friendly and helpful person. He grew up with his parents who made a living slaughtering pigs. Francisco helped with farm work and slaughtering in the mornings with his parents, and spent the afternoons studying at a school in his community. He studied until 6th grade, and discontinued his studies because he acquired knowledge and experience and as such decided to pursue the purchase and sale of pigs. He is one of the older siblings who worked in agriculture to provide sustenance for the family.

Francisco works in agriculture as well as in the purchase of pigs, which he buys and fattens. Sometimes he buys them from the market on Friday, to then sell to workers at the butcher’s shop. He learned this from a friend who also taught him how to plant corn: that part of the crop is for eating and the other part is for feeding animals. He has to travel many miles to buy pigs, as he goes door to door or purchases them on town market days.

The money will be used to buy pigs, since he has a space prepared in the house to feed and raise the animals until they are ready to be sold. This will in turn provide him with a better income, which he will invest in improving his home, as he hopes to build a room for his grandson.

Francisco’s plans for the future are to have a larger space, enabling him to raise more pigs. Additionally, with the help of a new loan he will begin to make a fish pond, as well as support his grandchildren’s education.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Yon's Group

texts.en:
A mother of five children residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Yon is 37 years old and a local farmer who does pig-raising as her main source of income. She has been involved with this business for 12 years and it has returned her 26,100 KHR per day. 

Now, Yon is leading a group of two; both of them are fourth-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In this cycle she is seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR and her co-borrower is requesting loan of 600,000 KHR. Yon will use her portion of the loan to buy pig feed and medicine to protect her pigs and keep them healthy. She hopes that her family’s living conditions will improve via this business.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and medicine to protect her pigs

loans.name: Baylagmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Baylagmaa, 39 years old, lives with her mother and son in Darkhan, second largest city of Mongolia. She has been running her photography studio since 2010. Her mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. Her son goes to high school. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy a color printer for her studio, because her previous printer is old and damaged. Also it is necessary to update equipment in order to keep up with her competitors.

loans.use: to buy a color printer

loans.name: Artelieta

texts.en:
Artelieta is 53 years old, married with 6 school-aged children.  She lives in Medallo, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental.

She has a farm and has had this for six years with a monthly income of 5,000 PHP. She signed up for her membership with Paglaum MPC in 2010.  She has turned to the Cooperative for her funding needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer.  The profit she earns in her business is used for daily expenses and the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the products needed in her business. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her rug-making business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Geraldine hopes that her business will be more established and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God they study.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her rug-making business.

loans.name: Apisa

texts.ru: Аписе 51год, она замужем, воспитывает 5 детей. Старший сын женат, проживает отдельно, двое детей-студенты, младшие- школьного возраста. У Аписы - среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей, как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Аписа в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже 25 лет занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур и откормом коров и бычков. Аписа начала свой бизнес с 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Аписы, она смогла развить и расширить свою деятельность, которая приносит около 22,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Также Аписа с супругом в качестве дополнительного дохода, уже много лет занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве имеется: 1 дойная корова и 1 лошадь. Земельный надел Аписы составляет 0,65 ГА своей и 2,0 ГА арендованной земли, где Аписа выращивает картофель, кукурузу, красный перец и томат. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Аписа обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку семян картофеля, минеральных удобрений, а часть средств она хочет потратить на обработку почвы. Доходы от кредита Аписа планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а также в будущем накопить средства на свадьбу дочери.
