Sometimes, her husband works as a paid worker to supplement their income. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 80,000 KHR per day to support her family.
 
This is the first loan for Sivorn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is requesting a loan with VisionFund of 3,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland and pay labor fees. She hopes to make more crop yields and sell the harvest for a good price in order to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sokmean's Group

texts.en: Sokmean, 32, is a rural villager residing in Battambang province. She is a mother of two dependent children who are in school. To overcome her family’s hardships, she grows paddy rice as the main source of income and works for others for a fee for extra income. By being involved in her current business, she is able to earn up to 40,000 KHR per day. Now, her living conditions are getting better, which is the result of the positive impact of her past loan. This is the sixth microloan for Sokmean and her joint borrower. She has fully repaid her past loan wisely and it has improved her living conditions so they are better than before. Now, she is requesting a loan of 1,400,000 KHR and her co-borrower is applying loan for 1,000,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for land smoothing fees and to buy seeds for her rice cropping. She hopes to increase her income and to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay the land smoothing fee and to buy seeds for her rice cropping

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn works hard to support her family. Emelyn has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a 6,000 PHP (Philippine peso) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Emelyn has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Emelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. Gemma is married and has a buy-and-sell fruits business in the Philippines.

She requested a 13,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks of fruits to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fruits to sell

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
Phan, aged 38, lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district and has six children, three of whom are dependents and still in school. 
This is the first micro loan for Phan with VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Ramy

texts.en:
Ramy is 42 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Ramy has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ramy requested a 14,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall.

Ramy has been in this business for four years. In the future, Ramy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jenny is 30 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Jenny requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Jenny has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Jenny would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Ее зовут Зулфия. Она одна из не многих жительницей маленького района Кубадиён. Ей 54 года. Она обзаведена семьей. У нее есть 30 летний сын. Так как ее сын единственный кормилец Зульфия решила начать деятельность и помочь сыну пополнить семейный бюджет и улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Зулфия намерена получить кредит, и купить сухофрукты в том числе, фисташки, изюм, миндаль и многое другое для перепродажи в местном рынке. Она верит, что ей удастся начать малый бизнес в сфере торговли, что принесет достаточный доход. Поддержите Зульфию.
texts.en: Zulfiya  belongs to the small community of the  Qubadiyon region inhabitants. She is 54 years old. She has a family, including a 30-year old son. Since her son is the sole breadwinner, Zulfiya decided to launch her own business and help her son with managing the family budget and improving the financial conditions of her family. Zulfiya's intention is to obtain a credit and buy dried fruits, such as pistachios, raisins, almonds etc for resale at the local market. She believes she will be able to launch a small retail business that would bring in sufficient income. Please support Zulfiya.

loans.use: to buy pistachios, raisins, almonds etc for resale.

loans.name: March's Group

texts.en:
Originating from Battambang province and a married mother blessed with four kids, March is 44 years old and a local farmer who grows rice and pineapples as the main source of income for the sake of her household. Apart from this business, she also earns extra income via her paid-working job. The business, which she has had for ages, earns her about 19,400 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day. 

This is the sixth loan for March, who is a leader of a group consisting of two with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR and her joint-borrower is applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy pineapple seedlings and to pay a plowing fee. She believes that her pineapples will produce better yields for her than last year's crop.

loans.use: to buy pineapple seedlings and to pay a plowing fee

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Sokun, aged 54, has two children in total. Sokun and her husband are rice farmers who have been farming for 20 years to make a living. The current business earns her about 30,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day to meet the family’s need. 

Sokun has been with VisionFund Cambodia for six cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her to improve her livelihood from cycle to cycle. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthily and also hope to make more rice to better off her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 44 years old and single and works very hard to provide for her parents.

Josefina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional household goods to sell.

Josefina has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Josefina would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Savorn's Group

texts.en:
Savorn, 42, lives with her husband and four children in a village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost 15 years and they can earn about 44,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day to meet the family’s needs
. 
Savorn has been with VisionFund Cambodia for three cycles and completely paid back the loans. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Pen's Group

texts.en: Pen is 52 years old and a resident from Battambang province. She has seven children, but currently she still needs to support her two kids who remain in school. To deal with the daily basic needs of her entire household, she plants rice and pineapple as the main source of income and does a paid-working job during her spare time to get extra income. This is the fifth-cycle loan for her and the second-cycle loan for her co-borrower with VisionFund  (Kiva’s partner). Both of them are requesting a loan 1,000,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy pineapple seedling and to pay for land preparation and plowing fees for her farmland. She hopes to gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy pineapple seedlings and to pay for land preparation and plowing fees

loans.name: Sao's Group

texts.en:
Sao, 55, is married with eight children residing in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. For the last 15 years, she has been raising pigs as the primary source of her family’s income. The current business earns her about 60,000 KHR per day. 

Sao has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now, she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Sao is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make raise crops in order to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Patricia Valentina

texts.es:
En San Jacinto  del cantón Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Bankito La Y. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.
En este lugar vive la señora Patricia, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 10 y de 6 años que  estudian en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Patricia para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y sandalias, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, trabaja de tres a cuatro días por semana y en momentos cuando esta mas desocupada, ella  deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad la misma que inicio con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución por lo cual está muy agradecida.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar zapatos y ropa de todo tipo. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace  4 años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
The Bankito La Y Communal Bank meets every 15 days in San Jacinto in the canton of Tosagua.  The area is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited by many national and foreign tourists.  It offers a variety of beautiful spots and a rich variety of typical dishes from the region. 

Patricia lives in this region; she is 28 years old, married, and has two children who are 10 and 6 years old who are in school.  Her husband is a driver. 

In order to help her husband with the household expenses, Patricia sells all kinds of clothing, shoes, and sandals.  She sells door-to-door and she also sells in her home where her best customers come to see her.  She works three or four days a week and when she is not too busy, she offers credit and collects every 15 days.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise whenever she needs to.  She has had her business for four years and she started it with the first loan she received from this institution, for which she is very thankful.  

She will use this loan to buy all kinds of shoes and clothing.  She has been with this communal bank for four years and she likes it because she used her first loan to start her business.  Her dream is to have her own home, as she currently rents.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing

loans.name: Losarty

texts.en:
Losarty is 38 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school. Losarty works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Losarty has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Losarty would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Rosalia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from rice retailing.  Rosalia is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Rosalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ya's Group

texts.en: Ya is 34 years old and a married mother blessed with three dependent kids. One of her kids is under-aged for schooling and the remaining two are in school. Rice farming and chicken raising are the main sources  of income, as this business has generated her around 25,000 KHR per day. Ya is not a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has managed her past loan smartly to improve her lifestyle at a gradual pace. For this cycle, she formed a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing fee and the reaping fee. She highly believes that she can gain more income so as she can expand her business on a larger scale.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees and reaping fees

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 53 years old, married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Maria has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Maria has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Marinol

texts.en:
Marinol works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Marinol has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Marinol would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Seak's Group

texts.en: A local villager from Battambang province, where paddy rice farming is the popular cash crop in the area among her neighborhood, Seak is also a local farmer. She grows rice as well to earn a decent income, 35,000 KHR, to cover the daily cost of living for the entire household consisting of four kids, one who is too young for schooling. This is the fourth loan for Seak and her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has fully repaid, has improved her lifestyle better than before. For this cycle, she teamed up in a group of two to get a new loan. She and her co-borrower are seeking 600,000 KHR and 800,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her cropping. She highly hopes that her rice will grow properly so she can collect a better yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her cropping.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is 35 years old, married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mirasol has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Mirasol has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya, aged 37, is a mother of three children, and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband runs a general store, from which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well, and some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an impressive tone and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built very good relationships with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business is running well. Due to good relationships, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Suriya requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. 

Suriya hopes that her husband will use the loan in a positive way, and that this amount will help him to cope with the demand. Suriya thanks Kiva and it's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
Vanna, aged 29, is a borrower from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is married and is blessed with two dependent children. 

To make a living, Vanna works as a construction worker for her main source of income, and a paid-worker for additional income. She is in her third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has now formed the group of two. She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 KHR and her joint-borrower is applying for a loan of 2,400,000 KHR. 

As the group leader, Vanna will use her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that this purchase will improve the sanitation practice in her household.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Marychille

texts.en:
Marychille is 26 years old, and is married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marychille has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

In the future, Marychille would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 38 years old, married and has four children, who are all in school.

Mary Jean is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for fifteen years. Mary Jean has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Mary Jean would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vinegar in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year, and earns additional income from selling rice.

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of vinegar to sell in her business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of vinegar to sell.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim 35 years old and is a housewife living in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Shamim's husband runs a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well, and some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an impressive tone and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone; he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town that is the reason his business running well. Due to good relation his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Shamim requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. 

Shamim hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in positive way, and that this amount will help him to cope with the demand. She thanks Kiva and it's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Sanita

texts.en:
Sanita is 44 years old and is married with four children. With two children in school, Sanita works very hard to provide for her family.

Sanita has been running a general store in the Philippines for two years. Now she has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as bread, coffee, canned goods, soap, shampoo, etc.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store, such as bread, coffee, canned goods, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is 64 years old and is widowed with five children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Leila runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for fifteen years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, snack food and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

In the future, Leila would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lyra

texts.en:
Lyra previously borrowed PHP 42,000 PHP which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lyra hopes to have a grocery store some day and dreams that all her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 59 years old, and is married with ten children, one of whom is in school. 

Violeta is a very hard working entrepreneur. For the past two years she has operated a general store in the Philippines. She has now requested a loan of PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, shampoo, etc.

In the future, Violeta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling root crops in the Philippines, which she has operated for the last 13 years. 

Winnie has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase more root crops to sell.

In the future she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more root crops to sell.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is 30 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. 

Zareena's husband is a rickshaw driver. He has been running an auto rickshaw for many years. For the past few days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of over-use. He feels that most of its parts are worn out. So, currently he is unable to generate any amount of income. He would like to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due a lack of funds, he is finding it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. 

Therefore, Zareena has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Zareena is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband cover the cost of a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita previously accessed a loan of PHP 20,000 that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another loan of PHP 20,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresita hopes to expand her business more and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: 06.08.04 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hồng operates a food stall/restaurant selling beverages. She has been in this business for three years, and the main hardship that she faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase drinks and processed food to resell.

Hồng is 29 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the 06.08.04 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hồng has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase drinks and processed food to resell.

loans.name: Say's Group

texts.en:
Say is 51 years old and is a villager from Prey Veng province. She is a mother of five children, two of whom are in school. 

To cover her family’s cost of living, she sells fruit as the main source of income. She has been in this business for 13 years. Now, she is seeking a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is the leader of the group which consists of four members, all of whom are in their first loan cycle. They are all seeking the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. 

Say will spend her entire loan portion to buy more fruit to re-sell. She hopes to expand her business to a larger scale, so that she will be able to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to re-sell.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 56 years old, and is a widowed mother of two children. 

Lucia is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, which she has been operating for thirty-two years. Lucia  has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza works hard to support her family. She is 36 years old and has a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has been running for the past three years. 

Annaliza has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase addiitonal bundles of fishing net.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase addiitonal bundles of fishing net.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is 32 years old woman and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. 

Jameela's husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw. His rickshaw is not working properly, and because of which he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible, however, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Jameela has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Jameela is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.

loans.name: Massavo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MASSAVO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Tatiana (celle dont la main est levée sur la photo) est âgée de 27 ans. Tatiana a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau primaire. Tatiana est mariée à un certain Parfait. Le couple n'a pas d'enfants. Tatiana vit seule avec son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Tatiana vend divers produits et des fruits à son domicile depuis sept ans. Tatiana s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Tatiana ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MASSAVO sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Massavo Group is made up of three women who live in the same neighbourhood. The group representative, Tatiana (the woman with her hand raised in the photo), is 27 years old. Tatiana received an education up to the primary school level. Tatiana is married to a man named Parfait, who she lives with. The couple has no children. Together, the couple meet the costs for their household expenses. In order to meet these expenses, Tatiana sells various products and fruit from out of her home. She has done this for the last seven years. Tatiana gets her supplies from a market in Benin. In order to further strengthen their buying power and better satisfy client demand, Tatiana and the other members of the Massavo Group are requesting their second loan from Alidé. Their previous loan was paid back in full.

loans.use: to buy various products and fruit

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy bundles of used clothes to be sell.

Flavia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Flavia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mean's Group

texts.en: Mean is a resident from Kampong Cham province. Her main source of income for the past thirty years has been farming cassava. She is forty-eight years old and has one daughter in school. She previously had a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), which has been fully repaid. The positive impact of her past loan enabled her to improve her lifestyle and to provide decent meals for her family. Now, she is leading a small group of two to get a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide and to pay a ploughing fee, labor costs and a reaping fee. She hopes to make a good yield and increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide and to pay a ploughing fee, labor costs and reaping fee

loans.name: Kheourn's Group

texts.en:
Kheourn, 49, is a local villager from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To cope with the costs of the family's basic needs, she raises pigs and runs a small grocery stall. She has been working in this business for many years and can earn 26,400 KHR per day. This her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). Her previous loans, which she fully repaid, allowed her to improve her living conditions.

She is a leader in a group of two borrowers. She is now seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR and her co-borrower is requesting 1,200,000 KHR. Kheourn will use her portion of the loan to buy more pigs to raise and to purchase pig feed. She hopes to increase her family’s income through this business and to improve her living conditions as well.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma thanks all Kiva lenders for her previous loan. It allowed her to improve her businesses selling fruit, vegetables and dumplings. As a result, she earned a greater profit and has improved her standard of living. 

She is now requesting a loan to pay her children's school fees. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Phann's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province, Phann is a forty-four-year-old who is blessed with four kids. Cassava farming is the only source of income for her entire household. She has worked in this for many years and it has provided her with a decent income.

She is in her third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She fully repaid her previous loan and has improved her living conditions as well. For this cycle, she joins a group of three to get a new loan of 1,600,000 KHR each. She will spend her portion of the loan on buying fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay for ploughing and labor fees. She hopes that she will gain better yield than before, so that she can keep improving her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and pay for ploughing and labor fees

loans.name: Helen Grace

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Helen Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a rice mill operator business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice and corn. Helen Grace is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her rice mill for her rice mill operator business.

Helen Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her rice mill

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
This is Miriam. She previously accessed a loan that she used for her dumplings and cashew nuts business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She is requesting a loan to purchase wheat flour, cashew nuts and cooking oil for her business. She appreciates Kiva for their financial support.

She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cashew nuts and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Sreyneang's Group

texts.en:
Sreyneang, 33, is a rural villager from Kampong Cham province. She has three children, two of whom are in school.

To cover her family’s daily cost of living, she grows rice and works at a factory for income. The business, which she has been involved in for ages, has returned her 22,000 KHR per day. This is not the first loan cycle for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and now she leads a group of three.  She has paid back her past loan completely, with a gradual improvement of her lifestyle. For this loan cycle, the total amount of her entire group loan is 3,600,000 KHR, of which 1,400,000 KHR is her loan portion.

As the leader of a group consisting of three, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to further increase her income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farming business. Liza has been in this business for 7 years, and she earns more income from selling vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now request a new loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is the age of 30 and living with her two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a motorcycle speed meter mechanic by profession; he repairs motorbike speed meters. He has been doing this business for many years. He provides the services nearby his hometown. Mostly people who have bikes like him to repair their bike's speed meter.

He has been running this business for many years and using expensive tools for repairing, which have gotten too depreciated. He wants to replace these tools with new ones, but he does not have money to buy new tools. Therefore, Shehnaz requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy new repairing tools and some spare parts for repairing motorcycles. Shehnaz says thank to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new repairing tools and some spare parts for repairing motorbike speed meters

loans.name: Raim's Group

texts.en: Originally from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Raim is 54 years old and the mother of seven children. The main source of income for her entire household is rice farming, which generates her about 39,000 KHR per day. She has been participating in this business for 15 years. This is not the first loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); she has repaid back her past loan completely and it has upgraded her standard of living. Now, she is leading a group of three to get a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay reaping and plowing fees. She hopes that her current business will enable her to live a proper life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay reaping and plowing fees

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her business.

Leonor has been in this business for three years. Leonor earns additional income from buying and selling nipa roofing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to increase her income greatly and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

Besides her food-preparing business, Asha also operates a green grocery business.

She is asking for a loan to buy fruits and vegetables and to pay for transportation. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried fish and vegetables business in the Philippines. Rowena has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional dried fish and vegetables to sell for her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish and vegetables to sell for her business.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Merly works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. 

Merly is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Merly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Chumbani

texts.en:
Chumbani appreciates her previous loan, which improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. 

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more sacks of cashew nuts for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of cashew nuts for her business.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel es una persona de 65 año de edad muy trabajador y responsable con excelentes principios morales y espirituales, es muy conocido en su comunidad  por la actividad que realiza por su amabilidad y carisma que lo caracteriza como una excelente persona por su buena educación y servicio a los demás. Vive con su familia formada por su esposa que se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos de su hogar,  además vive con una hija y dos nietos. Él se dedica a la agricultura especialmente, a la siembra de granos básicos como lo son: maíz, frijoles y maicillo él se creció con su padre y sus abuelos y su nivel educativo es de 9º grado y el motivo por el cual ya no continuo sus estudios fue porque el primer instituto le queda a 30 km de su casa y en aquella época no había trasporte. A medida que trascurrió el tiempo el señor Miguel adquirió experiencia y muchos conocimientos sobre la agricultura y es la actividad, que en la actualidad se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos


El señor Miguel se dedica a la agricultura actividad que realiza desde que era muy pequeño, pues la aprendió de su padre y su abuelo quienes le inculcaron buenos principios y valores y es lo que lo ha llevado a ser una persona muy conocida y respetada en la comunidad tiene 35 años de experiencia en la agricultura que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, ya que vende casi el 50% de sus cosechas y lo demás queda para el consumo de su familia, el lugar de su trabajo le queda a 3 km de su casa y a realizar esta actividad se suma la ayuda de uno de sus hijos quien le ayuda en horarios de 7:00 am a 1:00 pm

El dinero será utilizado para comenzar a preparar la tierra, ya que para la temporada agrícola que se acerca necesita rentar una nueva  parcela de tierra,  porque comenzara a cultivar sandia de esta manera tendrá parcelas de cultivo más diversificadas lo cual le dará una mayor fuente de ingresos al momento de vender las cosechas que serán invertidas en mejoramiento de su vivienda.


Las metas que él tiene a futuro son las de ampliar sus parcelas y diversificar sus cultivos, en cuanto a sus hijos y nietos apoyar en todo lo que sea necesario para su preparación y formación académica ya que manifiesta que uno de sus nietos quiere prepararse y estudiar para veterinario, y todo esto lo va lograr con la inversión de sus ganancias el buen manejo de un nuevo crédito ya que cuenta con mucha experiencia en el manejo de créditos para la agricultura.
texts.en:
Miguel is 65 years old. He is very hard-working and responsible and has good moral and spiritual principles. He is well-known in the community for his work, and for his friendliness and charisma. He is characterised as a good person, with a good up-bringing and known for helping others. Miguel lives with his wife, who looks after the home, and one daughter and two grandchildren. Miguel works in farming - he grows basic grains such as corn, beans and sorghum. Miguel grew up with his father and grandparents and completed up to ninth grade at school. He did not finish school as it was 30 kilometres from from his house and at the time there was no transport to get there. Over time, Miguel has gained experience and knowledge about farming and this work has become his main source of income.

Miguel has been working in farming since he was a young boy. He learned the trade from his father and grandfather, who instilled good principles and values in him. This work has led Miguel to becoming very well-known and respected in the community. Miguel has spent 35 years old working in farming and it has become his main source of income as he sells almost 50% of his harvests, while he keeps the rest for his family. Miguel's workplace is three kilometres from his house and one of his sons also helps him from 7 a.m. to 1 p.m.

This loan will be used to start to prepare Miguel's land. With the farming season soon to start, Miguel needs to rent a new plot of land as he is going to begin growing watermelons. By doing this he can diversify his work, giving him a greater income on selling the harvests. He can then use this income to improve his home.

Miguel's goals include: expanding his plots of land and diversifying his crops; and with regards to his children and grandchildren, he wants to support them in everything necessary for the education and Miguel tells us that one of his grandchildren wants to become a vet. Miguel can achieve these dreams by investing his profits in a new loan. He has a lot of experience with loans for farming.

loans.use: to begin to prepare the land in order to start growing watermelons.

loans.name: María Carlos

texts.es: María de 58 años de edad, solo estudio segundo grado y la razón principal por la que no pudo seguir estudiando fue que la escuela le quedaba muy lejos de sus casa y también que sus padres no tenían  los suficientes recursos para ayudarle, ella es madre soltera, tiene nueve hijos de los cuales solo tres viven con ella y dependen económicamente de ella de sus hijos solamente uno estudio hasta primer año de bachillerato, ella se dedica a la agricultura  desde muy joven le enseño a trabajar la agricultura, el lugar de su trabajo le queda cerca de sus casa ya que viven en el terreno donde realiza sus actividades, el crédito lo necesita para realizar un trabajo pendiente como lo es la recolección de leña  y otros arreglos en la propiedad, con lo cual generara algunos ingresos extras, para el sostenimiento de su familia, con lo de sus sueños ella quiere que sus hijas tengan su propia casa para que vivan tranquilos, también que trabajen que tengan un trabajo que le beneficie fuertemente en su familia.
texts.en: María is 58 years old and only completed second grade at school. The main reason that she could not continue with her education was that the school was very far from her house. Her parents also did not have enough money to support her. María is a single mother. She has nine children, only three of whom still live at home and depend on her financially. Only one of María's children studied up to the first year of high school. María makes a living in farming. From a young age she learned to work in this trade. María works very close to her home as she lives on the land where she works. María needs this loan in order to carry out work such as collecting firewood and other repairs on the land. With this loan, María will be able to earn a little extra to support her family. One of María's dreams is for her daughters to have their own house so that they may live peacefully. She also wants them to have good jobs which will help their families.

loans.use: to carry out work such as collecting firewood and other repairs on the land.

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en:
Ramzana is the age of 48, living with her four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a truck repairing mechanic by profession. He has been doing this business for many years. He provides the services near his hometown. People who have trucks like for him to repair their trucks.

He has been running this business for many years and using expensive tools for repairing. Those tools have become old and he wants to replace them with new ones, but he does not have money to buy new tools. Therefore, Ramzana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy new repairing tools and some spare parts for repairing trucks. 

Ramzana says thank to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new repairing tools and some spare parts for truck repairing.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 26 años de edad. Esta acompañado, juntos luchan cada dia por salir adelante, tienen un hijo de 7 meses de edad.  Miguel alcanzo estudiar hasta 9º grado de educación básica, después de dejar sus estudios se dedico a la agricultura(siembra de maíz y maicillo.

Él necesita el efectivo del préstamo para comprar materiales para la construcción del techo de su hogar, como lamina, clavos y madera y lo restante lo invertirá en la mano de obra de quien le realice el trabajo, pues quiere tener un techo seguro para su familia.

Sueña a futuro poner un negocio en su propia vivienda (tienda), la cual le ayudaría a obtener mas ganancias, darle un mejor futuro a su hijo y a su esposa.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 26 year old man. He has a partner and together they strive for success everyday. They have a 7 month old son. Miguel studied through 9th grade and, after leaving school, worked as a farmer (growing corn and millet).
He needs the cash from the loan to buy materials to construct a roof for his house, such as corrugated sheets, nails, and wood, and the rest will be used to pay for laborers for the work. He wants to have a secure roof for his family.
His dream for the future is to have a store in his house which would help him to make a profit and and give his son and wife a better future.

loans.use: to buy materials to build the roof of his house such as corrugated sheets, nails, and wood, and the rest will be used to pay for labor.

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
Age 46 and a resident of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Savy is a married mother blessed with four children. She earns a living via rice farming and a paying job, which she has had for 10 years. This business earns her about 36,000 KHR per day. 

This is the fourth loan cycle for Savy and her co-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans, which she has fully repaid, have enabled her to improve her lifestyle. Savy, who is the representative of her group, will spend her entire loan portion on fertilizer and on paying for plowing her rice farm. She hopes her rice will produce a good yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Pich's Group

texts.en:
Pich is 59 years old and a farmer who grows rice in the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. She is the breadwinner in the family and a widowed mother of five. 

She covers her daily cost of living via a betel-nut trading business and sesame farming, as the main sources of her income. She has been with this business for ages, and it has earned her a decent income with which to support her family. 

Now, she is seeking her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is the leader of a group of five borrowers requesting a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. She will spend her entire loan portion on sesame seeds and a plowing fee. She hopes that she can earn a better income than before.

loans.use: to buy sesame seeds and to pay for plowing.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Nancy Ondina Del Rosario

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito San Cristóbal, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 51 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos vive en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Nancy es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito tanto para el esposo y para ella, el marido se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos, el se desplaza hasta una granja de localidad y compra los pollos al por mayor y luego los lleva hasta un local que arrienda en el centro de la ciudad en la cual vende los pollos ya sea enteros o por libras, ella por su parte prepara deliciosos almuerzos los mismos que una vez preparados los lleva a entregar ya que son por encargos,  esta actividad le deja muy buenos ingresos y se siente útil realizando una labor que le encanta.
Este crédito es para comprar pollos y viveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 17 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta ya que con los créditos empezó su negocio que hoy le permite ganarse algo por su cuenta. Sus sueños son tener buena salud para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the loan group San Cristóbal meets every two weeks. This place is know for being very dynamic and the majority of people work in agriculture and raising animals as it is a very green area.
Nancy lives in this place. She is 51 years old, married, and has three grown children, one of whom lives with her. Her husband is in commerce.
Nancy is a very good wife who is requesting the loan for her husband as much as for herself. Her husband buys and sells chickens. He goes to a farm in the area to buy chickens wholesale and takes them to a place that he rents in the town center where he sells the chickens either whole or by the pound for food. For her part, she makes delicious lunches then delivers them to order. This brings her a good income and she feels useful doing work that she loves.
This loan will be used to buy chickens and foodstuff to prepare her dishes. She has been in the loan group for 17 years and she likes it because she started her business with one of the loans and today that enables her to earn her own income. Her dream is for her family and herself to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy chickens and foodstuffs

loans.name: Irene Rosario

texts.es:
En San Jacinto  del cantón Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Bankito La Y. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.
En este lugar vive la señora Irene, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 6 y de 3 años, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Irene es una ama de casa para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que generan su hogar se dedica al comercio,  ella vende ropa y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta. Su marido se dedica a la pesca para lo cual también utilizan parte del crédito para la pesca y compra y venta de pescado, él una vez que llega a las playas de la localidad les compra pescado a otros pescadores los mismos que una vez limpios los  vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta el lugar para llevarlos a otras ciudades, es así como ellos salen adelante con un trabajo que aunque duro es honrado.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, materiales de pesca y pescado para la venta. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la rapidez para conseguir los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un local comercial.
texts.en:
The Y community bank meets twice a month in San Jacinto.  The area is known for its beautiful beaches that attract nationals and foreigners alike.  The diverse landscapes around the town and the local food are other draws.
Sra. Irene, 25, and her husband have two children, 6- and 3-years old, respectively.  The oldest of the two children is now in school.  
Doña Irene is a housewife and works part-time to make an income of her own and to help her husband with family expenses.  She has a retail clothing business, going door to door to meet her customers.  Her husband is a fisherman and has a business buying and selling fish.  He buys fish from other fishermen, cleans the fish and sells them on to wholesalers who distribute them around the country.  Their work is hard, but honest.
Doña Irene will use part of this loan to buy clothing for resale and the rest to buy fish for her husband's fish-sales business.  This will be her first loan and she likes that she can secure it so quickly.  For the future, she wants a store of her own.

loans.use: to stock her retail clothing business and buy fish for her husband's fish sales business.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 56 years old, married and works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store.  

Lita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Lita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

loans.name: Pek's Group

texts.en:
Pek is a resident of Dambae district of Kampong Cham province and she is 47 years old. She is a married mother of one child who goes to school. 

To make a living, she does cassava farming as the main source of income. It is business that she has done for a long time and currently it returns her up to 26,400 KHR per day. 

For Pek, this is the third cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a group leader. The positive impact of her loans, which she has repaid with success, has improved her living condition and she can manage to provide three decent meals for her family now. 

Now, she is seeking a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR and her joint borrower is requesting a loan of 1,600,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for plowing and labor fees for her farmland. She hopes to expand her business and to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for plowing and labor fees.

loans.name: Rosa Candida

texts.es:
Rosa de 59 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora. Lucha cada día por salir adelante, apenas pudo cursar primer grado de educación básica por la falta de recursos económicos.  Rosa actualmente vive con su compañero de vida quien se dedica a la agricultura, trabajo que ha realizado toda su vida.
 
Ellos viven con sus 3 hijos y 2 nietos.  Rosa se dedica principalmente a las tareas del hogar(oficios domésticos); ocasionalmente apoya a su compañero en la temporada agrícola, sembrando maíz. Los fines de semana realiza ventas de refrescos naturales y hace panes con pollo. En este labor le ayudan sus hijas a preparar la venta. 

 Rosa como es una mujer que cada día busca mejorar su calidad de vida ha pensado en remodelar totalmente su pequeña casa, usando así el efectivo del préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción: Adobe, Madera, Tejas y clavos, ademas pagará la mano de obra y sus ayudantes.
A futuro sus sueños y aspiraciones van dirigidos a su vivienda, tenerla en condiciones seguras para todas las inclemencias del clima y no correr ningún riesgo. Finalmente manifiesta que desea poder tener una pequeña tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
59 year old Rosa is an enterprising woman. She strives to get ahead every day. She barely went to the first grade of school because of a lack of economic resources. Rosa currently lives with her partner who is a farmer, he has worked in agriculture all his life. 
They live with their 3 children and 2 grandchildren. Rosa principally does housework and she sometimes helps her partner with seasonal farming, sowing corn. At the weekends, she sells natural juices and makes bread with chicken. In this work, she helps her daughters prepare to sell. 
 Rosa is a woman who searches every day for ways to improve he quality of life. She has decided to completely remodel her little house, using the cash from the loan to buy construction materials: earth bricks, wood, shingles, and nails, and also to pay for helpers to do the work.
Her dreams and aspirations for the future are to keep working on her house so that it will be secure in all weather and not face any risk. Finally, she says that she wants to have a little store in her house.

loans.use: to buy earth bricks, wood, shingles, and nails, and to pay for labor and helpers to build her home.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
Modesto de 60 años de edad, no fue a la escuela por situaciones económicas sus padres nunca lo enviaron, él es casado y tiene ocho hijos, de los cuales solamente seis viven con él, él se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo, por lo menos tiene treinta años de realizar esta actividad, sus padres se la enseñaron, por lo que siempre ha trabajado en lo mismo, también hace el oficio de carpintería lo cual no la practica ya que no hay mucho trabajo de eso, el trabajo en la agricultura  todos los días, él recorre unos dos kilómetros para llegar a su trabajo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar abono, bomba, semillas  y fertilizantes, para seguir trabajando la tierra y que esto genere más ganancias  para que mejorar su estilo de vida,  piensa seguir trabajando fuertemente  en su actividad, sus sueños es comprar terrenos para dejarle a sus hijos para que ellos al igual que él trabajen la tierra.
texts.en:
Modesto, 60, had to leave school early because his family couldn't afford for him to go.  He's married and has eight children, six of whom still live at home.  Modesto has made his living from farm work for at least thirty years.  He learned farming from his parents and has always earned part of his living from it.  He is a carpenter, as well, but there's not much work and most of his income comes from farming.  His fields are two kilometers away.  

Modesto is applying to CREDICAMPO for a loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs--a pump, fertilizer, seeds, etc.--to carry on his business.  The investment will bring him a larger income and a better standard of living.  He plans to continue working hard to maintain the business.  For the future, he wants to buy land that he can eventually leave to his children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Rosali

texts.es:
Rosali de 30 años de edad, esforzado y trabajador. Lucha cada día por el bienestar de su familia. Actualmente tiene 2 niñas.

Él nunca asistió a la escuela, desde muy pequeño le ha gustado la vida en el mar, él es pescador. Trabajo que lo aprendió de su padre. El préstamo lo necesita para mejorar su equipo de trabajo, el cual es su armamento diario para subsistir. El necesita comprar redes, Corcho y plomo. 

Rosali sueña a futuro un mejoramiento en su calidad de vida. Una buena educación para sus hijas, pues es el mejor regalo que puede darle a sus pequeñas.
texts.en:
30 year old Rosali is tough and hardworking. He strives everyday for his family's wellbeing. He currently has 2 little girls.
He never went to school. Since he was very small he has enjoyed a life on the sea - he is a fisherman. He learned this work from his father. He needs the loan to improve his work tools, which are his weapons for daily survival. He needs to buy nets, floats, and lead.
Rosali's dreams for the future are to improve his quality of life and to give his daughters a good education as this is the greatest gift that he can give to his little ones.

loans.use: to buy nets, floats, and lead, to repair his fishing nets.

loans.name: Fabiola Marilu

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito El Arbolito, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Fabiola, tiene 52 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen 4  hijos  mayores de edad, cerca de su casa vive uno de sus hijos junto a su familia.
Doña Fabiola es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante a base de esfuerzo y trabajo, ella realiza varias actividades con las que sale adelante, es por esta razón que espera utilizar este crédito para ayudarse a comprar una moto taxi ya que este es el medio más utilizado en el lugar como transporte,  espera obtener buenos ingresos para ella y también crearle una fuente de ingresos para su hijo ya que es él quien va a conducir este vehículo con el cual el también pueda llevar algo para el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar una moto taxi. Este es el quinto ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener salud para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The El Arbolito community bank meets twice a month in the city of Tosagua.  It's a fast-growing area, known for the richness of its farmland, and most local people make their living from farming and raising animals.
Sra. Fabiola, 52, is separated from her husband.  Her four grown children live nearby with their own families.  
Doña Fabiola wants to get ahead with hard work and effort.  She makes a living doing various jobs and she is applying for a loan now because she wants to start a taxi business.  She will use the loan to buy a moto-taxi, the most common form of transportation here.  She says the investment will provide her with a good income and also give her son, who will operate the taxi, an income for supporting his own family.
This loan will be used to buy a moto-taxi.  Sra. Fabiola has joined five rounds of funding with the community bank and says that past loans have helped her to support herself.  Her hope for the future is that she and her family have good health.

loans.use: to buy a moto-taxi.

loans.name: Inés Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito San Cristóbal, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Inés, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos todos mayores  de edad e independientes. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Inés con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, ella compra leche y queso al por mayor y en su casa instala un pequeño local en el cual distribuye sus productos por libras y la leche por litros, desde muy en la mañana ella recibe a sus proveedores que le llevan estos productos hasta su casa el mismo que luego vende a sus clientes que a diario le llegan a comprar con lo cual ella se gana algo que le sirve para salir adelante. Lleva más de 19  años con este negocio.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar leche y queso para la venta. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener buena salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
The loan group San Cristóbal meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua. This place is known for being very dynamic and most of the people work in agriculture or raising animals so it is a very green area.
Inés lives in this place. She is 54 years old, married, and has 6 grown-up children from this marriage. Her husband is a driver.
Inés started a business with the intention of earning something by herself and so being able to get ahead and help her husband with the household expenses. She buys milk and cheese wholesale and has a little store in her home where she sells her products by the pound and the milk by the liter. Her suppliers start arriving at her house with these products very early in the morning and she sells these same products to her customers who go daily to buy from her, whereupon she earns something that helps her to get ahead. She has been running this business for more than 19 years.
She will use this loan to buy milk and cheese to sell. She has been with the loan group since its beginning and she likes it because she started her business with the first loan. Her dream is for her and her loved ones to have good health.

loans.use: to buy milk and cheese.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentín de 56 años de edad,  estudio hasta segundo grado , él es casado la esposa tiene un negocio de tortillas, en el centro de la ciudad, tiene ocho hijos de los cuales solamente dos viven con él  y tres nietos, uno de ellos asiste a la escuela , de él solamente depende la esposa, él se dedica a la agricultura y también tiene una vaca  la cual la cuida pues de ella obtiene los lácteos para el sustento de él y su esposa.

 El crédito lo necesita para comprar hierro y cemento, pues está haciendo unos corredores en la casa. El crédito le ayudara  porque necesita terminar su proyecto, sus  metas son mejorar su sistema de vida en lo económico, para sus hijos, piensa dejarles donde puedan vivir, el dinero que obtiene lo invierte en alimentación y en compra de animales como lo son cerdos y vacas.
texts.en:
Valentin, 56, left school after the second grade.  He is married and his wife has a tortilla sales business.  They have eight children, two of whom still live at home, and three grandchildren, one of whom is now in school.  The children are independent now and he and his wife only have to depend on one another.  Valentin has a farming business and keeps a cow that provides him and his wife with all the dairy products they need.

Valentin is applying for a loan that he will use to buy construction materials--rebar and cement--for a house improvement project.  The loan will allow him to complete the work that he's already started.  For the future, he wants a more secure income. He'd like to leave his house to his children so that they always have a place to live.  The loan will allow him to make the improvements because he needs most of his income to pay for everyday expenses and support his farming business.

loans.use: para comprar hierro y cemento, para terminar de construir un corredor.

loans.name: Eva María Josefa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito San Cristóbal, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 17 y 16 años, la mayor recién se graduó del colegio y espera seguir la universidad, el menor aun continúa en  colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña María junto a su esposo tienen un almacén en el centro de la ciudad en el cual venden todo tipo de telas y materiales de costura, hasta su local día a día llegan muchas personas a comprar las telas para confeccionar sus prendas, esta actividad aumenta siempre en temporadas de fiestas o en entrada a clases que es cuando más venden, pero por lo general siempre se mantienen con muy buena clientela, allí trabajan juntos desde hace 6 años en este local que es alquilado pero que por su ubicación les permite tener muy buenas ventas para el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar telas y otros materiales de costura. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque  los créditos les ayudan mucho en su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The credit group San Cristóbal meets in the city of Tosagua every fortnight. The city is known for being very dynamic, where most of the inhabitants work in agriculture and animal husbandry, due to it being an area with plenty of vegetation.

María lives in Tosagua. She is 46 years old, is married and has two children, aged 16 and 17. Her eldest child has just graduated from high school and is waiting to go to university. The youngest one is still in school. María's husband is a merchant.

María and her husband have a store in the city centre, where they sell all kinds of fabric and sewing materials. A lot of people come to her shop everyday to buy fabric to make clothes. The activity always increases during festive seasons or at the beginning of the school year, which is when they sell the most, however, they have always had a good clientele. They have worked together for the past six years in a space that is rented, but the location allows them to have very good sales, which is good for their family.

This loan is to buy fabric and other sewing materials. María has been with the credit group for four years, and she likes it because the loans really help her business. Her dream is to own her own shop.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing materials.

loans.name: Melida María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito San Cristóbal, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Melida, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo seis hijos pero uno falleció, los cinco que tiene ya son mayores  de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Melida es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y con esto poder lograr sus propios ingresos por el bien de sus familia, es por eso que hace más de 20  años decidió arrendar un local en una estación de servicios y montar un pequeño bar en el cual vende productos que ella misma prepara así como también sodas, jugos, aguas, energizantes y varios productos de picar elaborados, trabaja todos los días y en ocasiones le ayudan sus hijos y su esposo, pero es ella la que siempre está en el negocio, este negocio lo empezó poco tiempo antes de entrar al grupo pero que con los créditos que recibió lo surtió mucho mas.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su local, va a comprar víveres, sodas, jugos, aguas y helados. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio  y le gusta porque con uno de los  créditos ella mejoro su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un local propio ya que los arriendos se le llevan gran parte de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua the San Cristóbal credit group meets every two weeks. This place is known as being dynamic with the majority of its inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals, because it is an area with a lot of vegetation. 

This is where Melida lives. She is 55 years old, married and had six children but one passed away. The five that she has are grown and on their own. Her husband is a merchant.

Melida is a woman who likes to work and with that be able to have her own income for the good of her family. That is why, more than 20 years ago, she decided to rent a locale at a service station and opened a small snack bar where she sells products that she prepares herself as well as soda, water, juice, energy beverages and various snack products. She works every day and sometimes her children and her husband help her, but she is the one who is always at the business. She started this business a little bit before she joined the group, but with the loans she received she was able to stock it a lot more. 

She is going to use this loan to stock her locale more. She is going to buy groceries, soda, juice, water and ice cream. She has been in this credit group since it started and she likes it because with one of the loans she improved her business. Her dreams are to have her own locale because rent takes a large part of her earnings.

loans.use: to buy groceries, soda, juice, water and ice cream.

loans.name: Marcela Marlene

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito San Cristóbal, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Marsela, tiene 41 años de edad, está divorciada pero de esa relación tienen un hijo de 13 años que  estudia en colegio. 
Doña Marsela es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante y para darle lo mejor a su hijo, ella se dedica a la  venta de ropa de todo tipo, en su casa tiene una pequeña vitrina en la cual muestra su mercadería y es hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, ella también realiza sus ventas puerta a puerta o por pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedican a esta actividad  con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Lleva 4 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y seguros. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The San Cristobal community bank meets twice a month in the city of Tosagua. It's a fast-growing area, known for the richness of its farmland, and most local people make their living from farming and raising animals.
Marsela, 41, is divorced and has one son, 13, in high school.
