Doña Marsela likes working and says hard work is how she will build a better life for herself and her son.  She has a clothing sales business, buying and selling all kinds of clothing.  She has a display case in her house where her customers can see the merchandise she sells.  She meets other customers going door-to-door and sells to-order, as well.  She has operated the business for more than 10 years and says that it has provided her with a good living.
Doña Marsela will use this loan to stock her business with pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing.  She joined the community bank 4 years ago and likes that it provides fast and secure loans.  Her greatest wish is to give her son the very best of everything.

loans.use: to stock her retail clothing business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and lives in Lumbia, Pagadian City. She is single.
 
She has a store that sells retail products. She has had this business for a year and she requested a loan for additional capital.

Josephine has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes for an expansion.

loans.use: to buy additional retail items for her sari-sari store

location.town: Pagadian - San Jose District, Pagadian City

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
This is Mwanasha. She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work. 

She appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support.

She is asking for a loan to purchase cashew nuts, wheat flour, and transportation for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts, wheat flour, and transportation for her business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 52 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Delia is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Delia has been raising pigs for thirteen years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
María estudio hasta segundo grado, esta acompañada tienen cuatro hijos, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura; todos sus hijos estan acompañados ella vive unicamente con su compañero de vida, por lo tanto es la persona que depende de ella.

Ella se dedica a cultivar granos básicos como el maíz y el frijol, ella lleva un lapso de tiempo bastante amplio dedicándose a esta actividad. Este trabajo lo aprendió junto a su compañero de vida. Debido a que cuando se acompañaron él no tenia un trabajo fijo, ella tubo que trabajar tambien, el trabajo le queda a unas tres horas de su casa y viaja en camiones porque le queda lejos y hasta ese lugar no pasan buses solo camiones, pero cuando llueve solo caminando.  Su esposo le ayuda poco porque esta enfermo.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar abono, pesticidas, herbicidas para cultivar granos básicos; este préstamo a ella le beneficiara de gran manera puesto que de la cosecha genera ingresos para el diario vivir y cuando la temporada de café ella va a cortar.

El sueño de ella es que en este año la cosecha sea muy buena, para pagar el crédito y con lo que le vaya quedando terminar de comprar lo que le hace falta para tener cerrada su casita ya que no cuenta con ventanas ni puertas .
texts.en:
María went to school up to the second grade. She is married and they have four children. Her husband works in agriculture. All of her children are married and she lives alone with her life's companion. Therefore, he is the person who depends on her.

She grow basic grains such as corn and beans. She has been doing this activity for a long time. She learned this work with her life's companion because when they were married she didn't have a permanent job and she had to work as well. Their work is about three hours from their house and they get there in trucks because it is so far away and no busses go there, only trucks. When it rains, they have to walk. Her husband helps her a little because he is sick.

She will use the loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and herbicide to grow basic grains. This loan will benefit her greatly because she generates income from the harvest for her daily living. When it is coffee season, she does harvesting.

Her dream is that this year's harvest will be very good to pay for the loan. With what she has left over, she wants to finish paying for what she needs to finish enclosing her house because it has no windows or doors.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and herbicide to grow basic grains.

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es:
Rosa estudio hasta tercer grado, es casada, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, tiene cinco hijos, pero uno de ellos ya fallecio, todos ya tienen hogares aparte y ella solo vive con su esposo, un nieto que le dejo su hijo que vive en otro lugar y ella quedo encargada de él.

Ella siembra pepino, yuca, plátano y frijol  ya tiene aproximadamente 6 años de dedicarse a esto, lo aprendió de su madre y padre que ya falleció, desde que su padre enfermo, ella decidió trabajar para ayudar a su padre, él tenia una enfermedad que no le permitia trabajar.  Todo lo que ella cultiva  lo tiene a cinco metros de casa y trabaja de 7 a 12 am su esposo le ayuda.

Ella piensa comprar mas semillas y sembrar mas ya que su padre falleció y su madre ya esta mayor y quiere ayudarle un poco con los gastos de la casa. Con esto podrá sembrar mas y los frutos serán mejores,  podrá darle a sus nietos, un aporte económico ya que no tienen papas.

su sueño es, poder ver a sus nietos unos profesionales y que su madre pueda descansar y ella poder tenener mejores ingresos, con las ganancias esta segura que podra lograrlo.
texts.en:
Rosa went to school up to the third grade. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. She has five children, but one of them died. They all live on their own and she lives alone with her husband and a grandson that their son left with them when he went to live somewhere else and she started taking care of him. 

She grows cucumbers, yucca, plantains and beans. She has been doing this for approximately 6 years. She learned it from her mother and her father, who already passed away. When her father got sick, she decided to work to help him. He had an illness that didn't allow for him to work. Everything she grows is five meters away from her house and she works from 7a.m. to 12 p.m. Her husband helps her. 

She is planning on buying some seeds and to plant more, because her father dies and her mother is older and she wants to help her a little with the household expenses. With this, she will be able to plant more and the products will be better. She can give her grandchildren some financial support, because they don't have parents anymore.

Her dream is to see her grandchildren graduate from college and for her mother to be able to rest, as well as to have better income. With the earnings, she is sure she can achieve this.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and plant more.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 43 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal-vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Maricel has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cashew nuts for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Jammarine

texts.en:
Jammarine is 37 years old, married with two children.  Both attend school.  Jammarine works very hard to provide for them.

Jammarine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell.

Jammarine has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Jammarine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Olga Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito San Cristóbal, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Olga, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Olga con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta ya que su marido no gana mucho en el campo  se dedica al comercio, ella tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa donde vende  leche, queso, maní molido y varios productos más, todas las mañanas ella recibe el queso y la leche de agricultores de la zona, sus clientes le compran todos los días razón por lo cual sus ventas están aseguradas, lleva con este negocio casi 20 años y es con el cual  su familia a salido adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar leche y queso para la venta. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy necesarios para su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Grupo De Crédito San Cristobal (Saint Christopher Loan Group) meets every fifteen days in the city of Tosagua. This place is known to be very dynamic, where the majority of its inhabitants are dedicated to agriculture and raising animals, and for being a zone with a lot of vegetation. 

This is where Señora Olga lives. She is 56 years old and married, from which she has five children who are grown and independent. Her husband is a farmer. 

Doña Olga, with the intention of making something for her part since her husband no longer makes much in the field, is dedicated to commerce. She has a small business in her house where she sells milk, cheese, ground peanuts and various other products. Every morning she receives the cheese and milk from farmers in the area. Her customers buy from her everyday, for which reason her sales are assured. She has almost 20 years in this business and it is with this that her family has come out ahead. 

She is going to make use of this loan with the purchase of milk and cheese for her sales. She has been in the Loan Group since its beginning and she likes it because the loans are very necessary for her business. Her dream is to come out ahead.

loans.use: to purchase milk and cheese.

loans.name: María Eloisa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito San Cristóbal, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 29 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 10 y 7 y 5 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es Ing. eléctrico.
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta ganar a base de trabajo y con esto poder  obtener lo suyo para darles lo mejor a sus hijos, ella prepara deliciosos almuerzos pero solo por encargos, de lunes a viernes ella entrega los almuerzos en varias instituciones de la localidad las cuales les piden sus platos, ella cada vez tiene más clientes ya que cocina delicioso y también porque les deja a crédito.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para prepara los platos. Lleva un año  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ella. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In city of Tosagua, the "San Cristóbal" loan group meets every fortnight. Tosagua is known for being a very dynamic place, where the majority of inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals because of the high amount of vegetation.

And it is here that 29-year-old María lives. She is married and has three children, aged ten, seven and five years old each. They are studying at school. María's husband is an electrical engineer.

María is a women who likes to work to earn money so that she can give her children the best things in life that she can. María prepares delicious lunches on order - from Mondays to Fridays - and delivers them to various local places. María's customer base is growing as her meals are very tasty and also because she sells on credit.

This loan will be used to buy supplies to prepare her meals. María has been with the loan group for one year and she likes it because the loans are of great help for her. María's dream is for her children to have a profession.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a general store in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy canned goods, eggs, chips, soap, shampoo, etc., for her general store.

Elvira has been in business for 10 years.  She also earns income from selling vegetables.

Elvira successfully paid back her previous loan and now request a new loan to build her business.

Elvira has sustained her business through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, chips, bread, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 35 years old, married with eight children, one attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Jenelyn sells bamboo in the Philippines and requests a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy bamboo to sell.

Jenelyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, Jenelyn would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy bamboo.

loans.name: Merlin

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Merlin works hard to support her family.

She runs a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns income by buying and sell fish.  Merlin is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy fishing net and other materials for her fishing business.

Merlin has been sustaining her business with her five previous loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other materials.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
This is Mwanalima. She appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support needed to greatly improved her business. 
 
She would like to apply for a loan, to buy more food items such as vegetables, cashew nuts for her business.

Mwanalima looks forward to financial support with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more food items such as vegetables and cashew nuts.

loans.name: Lourdes Mariana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito San Cristóbal, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Lourdes, tiene 64 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes, con ella viven dos nietos de 19 y 14 años los mismos que están a su cargo y estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Lourdes es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta a base de su esfuerzo salir adelante, ella confecciona ropa de preferencia ropa de mujer y de niños, también realiza el crédito para su marido el cual tiene una tercena en el mercado local donde vende carne de res y de chancho a clientes que a diario llegan hasta este centro de abasto a surtirse de productos para el diario vivir, ella por su parte trabaja todos los días en su casa confeccionando ropa a clientes. Es así como ellos se ayudan gracias a sus trabajos para darles lo mejor a su familia. 
Este crédito es para comprar carne y materiales de costura. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ellos. Sus sueños son que sus nietos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Grupo De Crédito San Cristóbal (Saint Christopher Loan Group) meets every fifteen days in the city of Tosagua. This place is known for being very dynamic where the majority of its inhabitants are dedicated to agriculture and raising animals, and for being a zone with a lot of vegetation. 

This is where Señora Lourdes lives. She is 64 years old, and married from which she has three children, all grown and independent. Her two grandchildren of 19 and 14 live with her. They are in her care and study in college and high school. Her husband is a businessman. 

Doña Lourdes is a very hardworking woman, which she likes based on her strength to come out ahead. She makes clothing, preferably for women and children. She is also requesting this loan for her husband, who has a butchery in the local market where he sells beef and pork to customers who come to this supply center daily to stock up on products for daily life. She for her part, works everyday in her house making clothing for her customers. Thanks to their jobs they help each other to give the best to their family. 

This loan is to purchase meat and sewing materials. She has been in the loan group since its beginning and she likes it because the loans are very helpful for them. Her dream is that her grandchildren become good professionals.

loans.use: to purchase meat and sewing materials.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 36 years old and married with two children who attend school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Amalia runs a buy and sell roofing materials in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy additional roofing materials to sell.  She has been in this business for four years.

In the future Amalia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional roofing material to sell.

loans.name: Fruit Haie Vive Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Fruit Haie Vive est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Tossinmé Jeanne  (celle dont la main est levée sur la photo) est âgée de 49 ans est mariée un mécanicien du nom de Sylvère. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés, et un à leur charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a trente ans environ que Tossinmé Jeanne vend des fruits dans un marché de sa région. De façon secondaire, Tossinmé Jeanne  vend également des légumes. Tossinmé Jeanne  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Tossinmé Jeanne et les membres du groupe Fruit Haie Vive sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group Fruit Haie Vive comprises three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Tossinmé Jeanne (with her hand raised in the photo), is 49 years old and married to a mechanic named Sylvère. The couple have five children, not all in school and one their care. 

The couple jointly ensure that the diverse family expenses are covered. To do so, Tossinmé Jeanne has been selling fruit at a regional market for thirty years. On the side, she also sells vegetables. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

This is the second time that Tossinmé Jeanne and the members of her group have requested financial support from ALIDé with the goal of bolstering their businesses and coping better with customer demands. The previous loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase fruit & vegetables

loans.name: Akuvi Aline's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Akuvi Aline(celle dont la main est levée sur la photo) est âgée de 41 ans est mariée un certain Magloire. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour ce faire depuis dix ans environ, Akuvi Aline vend de la nourriture accompagné de boissons, du jus d'ananas et de citron à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Akuvi Aline vend aussi de la bouillie accompagné de beignes fait à base de farine de blé. Akuvi Aline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Akuvi Aline et les membres de son groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
This group comprises three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Akuvi Aline (with her hand raised in the photo), is 41 years old and married to a man named Magloire. The couple have five children, all in school and in their care. 

The couple jointly ensure that the diverse family expenses are covered. To do so, Akuvi Aline has been selling food, as well as drinks made from pineapples or limes, for about ten years out of her home. On the side, she also sells porridge served with beignets made from wheat flour. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

This is the first time that Akuvi Aline and the members of her group have requested financial support from ALIDé with the goal of bolstering their businesses and coping better with customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase fish, pineapples, and lemons

loans.name: Mwanapole

texts.en:
Mwanapole is requesting for a loan to purchase three sacks of cashew nuts for her business

She greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for their previous financial support that enabled her get more income to support her daily needs.

Mwanapole joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Cresenciana

texts.en:
Cresenciana is 54 years old and married with two children.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Cresenciana runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 45000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like canned goods, snack foods, spices and school supplies.

Cresenciana has been in business for seven years. 

In the future Cresenciana would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase groceries like canned goods, snack foods, spices and school supplies.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She would like to borrowi PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase a fishing net and gasoline for her fishing business.

Lilia has been in this business for three years. Lilia also earns more income by sell dried coconut meat.

Lilia has sustaied her business through her own efforts with the help of oans from NWTF.  

She dreams to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net, gasoline for her fishing business

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida, 40, is a mother of three children and they live in Lahore, Pakistan.  

Her husband runs a general store and sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap biscuits etc. He manages the household and speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. 

Due to his behavior and tone he has very good relations with customers.  His general store is very famous in town and he runs the store well and sales have increased, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand.  Therefore, Sajida requests a loan for her husband to buy wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. 

Sajida thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.  She hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way; this loan will help him to cope with the demand.  Sajida thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 36-year-old woman who is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Shakeela’s husband is a rickshaw driver who has been running an auto rickshaw for the last year. For many days, his rickshaw has not been running properly and he has been unable to generate any income. Shakeela’s husband wants to repair his rickshaw as soon as possible but he lacks the money to cover the cost of repairs.

Shakeela is requesting a loan through the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Her loan will help him to continue his business. Shakeela is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco de 39 años de edad, padre de cuatro hijos.Quien se sacrifica por darles lo mejor.
Francisco estudio hasta quinto grado, él esta acompañado y su pareja se dedica a la venta de pupusas, con esto ella lo apoya en los ingresos del hogar.

Él se dedica a la agricultura, trabajo que le enseñaron sus padres quienes también eran agricultores. Este trabajo lo ejerce desde hace 25 años. Trabajo que le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a sus hijos, quienes 3 de ellos están en la escuela.

Francisco necesita el préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, pesticidas para las plagas y semillas para la siembra de sandia, lo cual le ayudara a mejorar la producción y así tener mejores ingresos.
El plan de Francisco es seguir trabajando y ver crecer a sus pequeños y poder darles lo mejor, ya que por ellos se desvive cada dia!
texts.en:
Francisco is 39 years old.  He is a father to four children and has sacrificed to give them the best.  Francisco studied through the fifth grade.  He is in a relationship, and his partner works selling pupusas [a traditional snack].  With this she helps out with the household income.

Francisco works in agriculture, a field of work that his parents, who were also farmers, taught him.  He has been doing this work for 25 years.  This type of work has helped him to get his children ahead.  Three of his children are in school.

Francisco needs this loan to buy fertilizers, manure, pesticides, and seed to sow watermelon, which will help him to improve his production and therefore to have a better income.

Francisco’s plan is to keep working and to watch his little children grow up.  He plans to be able to give them the best, because it is on their behalf that he does his utmost everyday!

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, pesticides, and watermelon seeds

loans.name: C. Sylvie's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée C. Sylvie celle dont la main est levée sur la photo) est âgée de 32 ans, a très peu fréquenté l'école. C. Sylvie est mariée un électricien bâtiment du nom de Siméon. C. Sylvie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour ce faire depuis vingt ans environ, C. Sylvie vend de façon ambulante et par la technique de distribution des produits de toilettes, de l'huile végétale et du pétrole. C. Sylvie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que C. Sylvie et les membres de son groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
This group comprises three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, C. Sylvie  (with her hand raised in the photo), is 32 years old and has had little schooling. She is married to a building electrician named Siméon. She lives together with her husband and children. The couple have four children, all in school and in their care. 

The couple jointly ensure that the diverse family expenses are covered. To do so, C. Sylvie  has been selling personal care products, vegetable oil, and kerosene, all by hawking or through the distribution system. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

This is the second time that C. Sylvie  and the members of her group have requested financial support from ALIDé with the goal of bolstering their businesses and coping better with customer demands. The previous loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase personal care products, vegetable oil, and kerosene

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
This is Milagrosa, 48, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Ariel and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Milagrosa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Milagrosa dreams to expand her business more and hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en:
Desiree is 35 years old and married with three children. For the past 10 years, she has run a direct sales business selling beauty soap in the Philippines. She also earns an income from vending food and she and works hard to provide for her family. Desiree has borrowed and repaid 25 previous loans through NWTF.

Desiree is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of beauty soap to sell. In the future, she aspires to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase beauty soap to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of one school-going child. For the past 20 years, she has operated a business selling cashew nuts at the market. Fatuma sells to passersby and neighbors. She owns a house without electricity or running water and cites seasonality as her major business challenges. Fatuma joined Yehu to boost her business.

Fatuma is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Anjielica Marie

texts.en:
Anjielica Marie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a veterinary supply business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. She earns more income from farming rice.

Anjielica Marie is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks of veterinary products to sell for her veterinary supply business. Anjielica Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of veterinary products to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 49 years old and married with seven children.

Nenita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Nenita has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn is a married parent of seven children. She runs a business selling bananas in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from buying and selling eggs. Bebelyn works hard to support her family. She has been sustaining her business activities with her past 27 loans from NWTF.

Bebelyn is requesting a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of bananas to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Amilcar Adilson

texts.es:
Amilcar un joven de 25 años de edad; su nivel académico es de bachiller general el vive junto a sus padres y dos sobrinos, el es un joven luchador que desde su temprana edad se ha dedicado a la producción agrícola, siembra de maiz y frijoles lo cual aprendió de su padre,  Ademas de ese labor tambien trabaja en la comunidad en mantenimiento de agua. Él utilizara el crédito para construir un cerco perimetral de su vivienda con el efectivo comprara arena, cemento, piedra, hierro y un rollo de malla esto para proteger su propiedad y brindarle una mejor seguridad a su familia.

A futuro Amilcar pretende tener una vivienda que reúna las condiciones de seguridad, para que su familia se sienta segura y puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Amilcar is a 25 year-old young man; he has a high school-level education.  He lives together with his parents and two nephews.  He is a hardworking young man who, from a young age, has worked in agriculture, sowing corn and beans.  He learned this from his dad.  Besides that work, he also works in the community maintaining the water.  

He will use this loan to build a perimeter fence around his home.  With the money, he will buy sand, cement, stone, iron, and a roll of fencing.  This will protect his property and give his family better security.

In the future, Amilcar aims to have a home that brings together safety features, so that his family feels safe and can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, stone, iron, and a roll of fencing to protect his property and provide better security for his family.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 36 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, etc.

Editha has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and seling charcoal.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, etc

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia a hardworking woman with two school-going children.  She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Sophia operates a cafe business making staple foods like rice, tea, beans, and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality  as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase a stock of ingredients: maize flour, wheat flour, rice and beans for the business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of ingredients: maize flour, wheat flour, rice and beans for the business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresita dreams that her business will continue to expand and hopes to have a better living. She attends our fellowship meetings every week, because she finds strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an advanced graphic design program for her work

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Jeana is 35 years old, married, and has one child who is in school.

Jeana is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

Jeana has been farming vegetables for ten years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jeana would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Sada

texts.en:
This is Sada. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. Besides a water-selling business, Sada operates a cashew nuts business. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing.

Sada is requesting a loan to purchase more cashew nuts for her business. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase more cashew nuts for her business.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a divorced woman who has been blessed with five children, three in school and two adults. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanarusi operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and to villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale.She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Zareena is a 40-year-old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She looks after her family made up of six people, including her four children. Her elder son has been running a restaurant for the last few years. He provides services to the people for good and fresh food meals. His restaurant is situated in the main market. Many shop keepers come in his restaurant to eat delicious food. He needs some crockery and fresh food items to develop his business. In this regard, Zareena made contact with Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan. BRAC issued a loan to Zareena for the development of her elder son's business. Zareena is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy some crockery and fresh food for restaurant.

loans.name: Antonia Gloribel

texts.es:
Antonia, con la edad de 53 años,  tiene un nivel académico de 9º grado de educación básica.
Con esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado que su hijo se haya preparado como profesional siendo Licenciado en Derecho, quien le apoya económicamente en los gastos del hogar, ya que ella es madre soltera desde hace 25 años,  Antonia vive con su hijo y una nieta de 9 añitos.

Ella se desarrolla en la actividad de comercio de tienda y pupuseria, en esta actividad lleva casi 30 años  conociendo este rubro pero de desempeñarlo como propietaria lleva aproximadamente 15 años.  
Desde muy temprano comienza su labor desde las 5.00 am de la mañana hasta las 9.00 pm de la noche.
Ella utilizara el efectivo del préstamo para comprar productos para su negocio, ya que algunos algunas cosas Le hacen falta, tales como: refrescos naturales, panes, confites y golosinas.
 Antonia a futuro sueña con un negocio rentable que le permita llenar las necesidades de sus clientes y a la vez desea que su pequeña nieta obtenga una buena educación para su futuro y contar con una vivienda que reúna las condiciones de seguridad de su familia.
texts.en:
Antonia, aged 53, achieved an acadmic level of 9th grade in basic education. With effort and dedication, she has gotten her son educated as a professional with a law degree, and he helps her economically with household expenses, since she has been a single mother for the last 25 years. Antonia lives with her son and a granddaughter who is 9 years old.

Antonia is a merchant and sells popular local snacks (pupusas). She has done this for almost 30 years, practicing the trade, and as a proprietor for approximately 15 years.

Antonia begins her work very early, at 5:00 in the morning, and continues until 9:00 at night. She will use the money from the loan to purchase products for her business, since she lacks things such as natural drinks, bread, sweets and candy.
 
Antonia's future dream is that her business should be profitable, permitting her to stock up on the necessities that her customers want, and that her little granddaughter may obtain a good education for her future and can count on having a home that offers her family security.

loans.use: buy natural drinks, bread, sweets and candy to sell.

loans.name: Vevirly

texts.en:
Vevirly previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would now like to apply for a 9,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Vevirly dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Bebeth Isabel

texts.en:
Bebeth Isabel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soap, chips, sugar, eggs, spices, etc for her general store business.

Bebeth Isabel has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from buying and selling accessories.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Bebeth Isabel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, chips, sugar, eggs, spices, etc

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Amelia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Amelia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like net, wood, gasoline, etc. for her fishing business.

Amelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like net, wood, gasoline etc

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 37 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more daily-use goods for her business like canned goods, eggs, milk, chips, bread, etc.

Alona has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more daily-use goods for her business like canned goods, eggs, milk, chips, bread, etc

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. With her previous loan, she was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her loan helped not just her business but also in the education of her children. Her income is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. The profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Consolacion dreams of being more successful in her business and hopes to become rich. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed for her business.

loans.name: Nehal Group

texts.en:
This group is called Nehal. It is made up of five women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They are hardworking and enterprising women. They took a loan of 130,000 YER from AMB. 

Hasin is the group's leader. She is 27 years old and married.  One of Hasin's goals is to continue to grow her business. Since she has professional experience in this field, she has attracted more customers. She started in her business to help her husband cover their family's expenses. Since she earned a good amount of money, she decided to continue. She started selling Sambusa (a traditional food) five years ago.  The income from this business is very low and she hopes to improve it. 

For this reason, she applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB. She is using her share of the group loan to purchase more ingedients such as flour, sugar, and tangs in order to make Smbusa (a traditional food) and sell them to her customers. This loan will allow her to strengthen her business so that she can increase her revenue. 

Hasin hopes to earn large profits so that she can improve her savings in order to obtain a big loan, further expand her business, and open a small shop for the Sambusa sales.

loans.use: to purchase more of goods in order to make Smbusa (a traditional food)

loans.name: Catalino

texts.es:
Catalino de 54 años de edad. Padre de 10 hijos, casado, junto a su compañera de vida luchan por seguir adelante.  Catalino se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años, trabajo que lo aprendió de sus padres, ademas de eso cuando puede desempeñar la actividad de albañil. Trabajos que son muy rentables en la sostenibilidad de su hogar.  El crédito lo utilizara para comprar fertilizantes, semilla, insecticidas y otros para la siembra de sandia que año con año lleva a cabo en sus parcelas.

A futuro sueña que Dios le siga dando sabiduría y lo guie siempre por el camino del bien para seguir trabajando y asi darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos y a su esposa a quines ama muchísimo.
texts.en:
Catalino is 54 years old and the father of ten children. He is married and he and his companion struggle to get ahead.  Catalino has been farming for many years; this is work he learned from his parents. When he has time he also works as a bricklayer. Both are jobs that are profitable and contribute to meeting his household expenses.

He will use the loan to buy fertilizer, seed, insecticide, etc. for growing watermelon which he grows every year on his land. He hopes that in the future, God will continue to give him wisdom and will always guide him on the right path so that he can continue to work and provide a better future for his children and his wife whom he loves very much.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, insecticide, etc. for growing watermelon which he plants every year on his land.

loans.name: Adela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Adela tiene la edad de 45 años, tiene 3 hijos, en su casa de habitación también vive una nuera y 2 nietecitos. Actualmente esta casada.
Ella es ama de casa, sus ingresos provienen de familiares que residen en el extranjero, ella posee lo que es una pequeña lancha que administra su esposo. 

Adela necesita el efectivo del préstamo, para reparar el motor de su lancha que se le ha dañado.
A futuro ella sueña ver a toda su familia reunida en optimas condiciones y una sostenibilidad rentable.
texts.en:
Adela is 45 years old and has 3 children. A daughter-in-law and 2 little grandchildren also live in her home. She is currently married. 

She is a homemaker, and her income comes from family members who live abroad. She owns a small boat which is operated by her husband.

Adela needs the funds from the loan to repair her boat's motor, which has become damaged. 

In the future, she dreams of seeing her whole family reunited under favorable conditions, with a sustainable economic situation.

loans.use: to repair her boat's damaged motor.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell herbal product business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Marlyn is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of herbal products to sell.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 30 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of herbal products to sell

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell root crop and vegetable business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Leonida has been in this business for 11 years. She earns more income from buying  and selling meat and from her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Moung Russey district, Khorn is 54 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is still in school. She is a rice farmer. Having been in this business for almost 15 years, she currently can earn about 26,900 KHR per day.
 
Khorn has been with VisionFund for one cycle and has completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, 58, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. Single, she works hard to provide for her everyday needs.  Aside from her variety store, she also sells rice and frozen foods for additional income.

Yolanda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Yolanda dreams of having a supermarket someday and hopes to have a good health.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene la edad de 37 años, Casada con un caballero que se dedica a la venta y compra de ganado, tienen 2 pequeñas hijas, a quienes aman muchísimo.
 Juana se dedica a la venta de lácteos, cuajada, crema, requeson y leche. Desde hace aproximadamente 15 años, negocio que lo aprendió de una madrina. 
Es una labor a la que le ha dedicado mucho tiempo, ademas es algo que le da muy buenos ingresos.
Lastimosamente Juana se ha enfermado y pues tendrá que someterse a una pequeña cirugía en su cuerpo, ella siente en dejar su negocio por unos días, le conforta saber que lo dejara en buenas manos.

pues su negocio lo atenderá una hermana mientras se recupera pues es a quien le tiene mucha confianza.
 Juana se ve realizada en futuro, siendo una comerciante en mayoreo, ademas verse totalmente recuperada de salud, desea ver a sus hijas convertidas en unas profesionales administrando su propio negocio. Siendo así personas de éxito en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Juana is 37 years old and is married to a man who buys and sells cattle.  They have two small daughters whom they love very much. Juana has been selling dairy products including cheeses, cream and milk for about 15 years, a business that she learned from one of her godmothers. She spends a lot of time at this and it provides a good income.

Unfortunately, Juana has been ill and needs to undergo a small operation. She regrets that she will have to be out of work for a few days but feels better knowing that she is leaving it in the capable hands of one of her sisters while she recuperates. 

In the future Juana sees herself being a wholesaler and totally recuperated from her illness. She hopes to see her daughters become professionals, running their own businesses and being successful in their community.

loans.use: to pay for surgery.

loans.name: Las Guerreras Group

texts.es:
El grupo LAS GUERRERAS está en su primer ciclo del programa de comités, son 18 mujeres muy trabajadoras y por sobre todo muy luchadoras, que tienen mucho entusiasmo de seguir creciendo. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rossana, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir en un nivel medio.
Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que tiene venta de lencería, donde ofrece siempre buena variedad que sus clientes siempre aceptan. Rossana es una mujer muy trabajadora que con lucha está saliendo adelante.
La Sra. solicita de este préstamo para la compra de las prendas de lencería para la  lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, y a mejorar sus ingresos, para seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The 'Las Guerreras' group is in their first loan cycle of the 'programa de comités' (committee program). The group is made up of 18 women who are very hardworking, and most of all, very determined. They are very eager to continue growing. They are taking the poverty elimination survey. One of the members is Rossana. Her last survey showed she was within a level 2 poverty stage, which is an average level.

Among the work that Rossana does, she sells lingerie and always offers a good selection, which her clients always accept. She is a very hardworking woman who is striving to get ahead. Rossana is requesting this loan for the purchase of lingerie, which will help her solidify her business plan and improve her income so she can continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Creciendo Juntas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su segundo ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que por medio de la ayuda en conjunto quieren ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nemecia, quien se dedica al humilde trabajo de ventas de jabones de todo tipo. Comenta que por medio de su sacrificado trabajo tiene los ingresos que necesita para poder ayudar a su familia. Cuenta que poco a poco quiere crecer y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Nemecia pide este préstamo ya que quiere poder seguir con sus ventas de jabón, es por eso que quiere poder comprarlo s y continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en:
This group is in its second cycle in the women's committee program. These women are heads of household, who, with their support of each other strive to help their loved ones. 

One of the members is Nemecia whose work is selling all kinds of soap. She states that because of her humble work she has the income she needs to help her family. She says that little by little she wants to grow and help her loved ones. She is asking for this loan so she can buy soap so she can continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy soap for resale.

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es:
Marcos tiene cuarenta y tres años, es casado tiene cuatro hijos de estos solo tres viven con él y asisten a la escuela, la esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, con ellos vive la mamá de él, lleva ya mucho tiempo de dedicarse a la albaliñeria y tambien trabaja en la agricultura, el trabajo lo aprendio de un amigo con el que trabajaba, al trabajo se desplaza a pie en el pueblo donde él vive. 

El crédito lo necesita para cancelar una deuda que ya tenia, pero los anteriores créditos que tenia los utilizo en el mejoramiento de sus casa, de lo cual el se siente feliz porque les ha dado comodidad a su familia.  Para sus hijos el quiere que estudien, pues piensa que las condiciones de trabajo son diferentes hoy en dia, las ganancias del trabajo las guarda para cancelar deudas, y los gastos de la familia
texts.en:
Marcos is forty-three years old and married with four children, only three of which live with him and go to school. His mother also lives with them. His wife takes care of the household chores, while he has already spent a long time working in construction and also works in agriculture. He learned this occupation from a friend that he worked with. He goes to work on foot in the town where he lives. 

He needs the loan to repay a debt that he already has. The previous loans that he had were used to improve his house, which he feels happy about as he has made his family comfortable. He wants his children to study, as he thinks that working conditions are different nowadays. He keeps his work earnings to repay debts and the family expenses.

loans.use: to repay a debt

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Gemma works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice. She is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy a new bundle of fishing net for her fishing business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a new bundle of fishing net for her business

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married with three children, two in school and one an adult. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Saumu has operated a clothing sales business for the past four years. She operates door-to-door, selling to neighbors, fellow town dwellers, and passersby. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business.

Saumu wants to use the loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Niño Salvador Del Mundo Group

texts.es:
El grupo NIÑO SALVADOR DEL MUNDO está en su ciclo número tres del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales se encuentran mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Zulma integra este grupo, ella se dedica a las ventas varias, y lucha por poder sacar adelante a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Ella es una persona muy luchadora que con sacrificio y lucha está creciendo día a día.
Zulma pide este préstamo para poder comprar naranja, banana, tomate, lechuga, etc., y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas, procurando un mejor futuro para su familia.
texts.en:
The 'Niño Salvador del Mundo' group is in their 3rd loan cycle of the 'programa de comité' (committee program). All of the members work and help each other get ahead. They are taking the poverty elimination survey. Through effort, continuous work, and by applying vital behaviors, they find themselves improving their poverty-stricken situations.

Zulma is a member of this group. She sells a variety of products and strives to provide for her family through her work. She is a very determined person who is growing every day through sacrifice and hard work. Zulma is requesting this loan to purchase oranges, bananas, tomatoes, lettuce, etc., which will allow her to continue with her sales and to provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas, tomatoes, lettuce, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, a 29-year-old married mother of two from Mwingi, earns a living for her family by operating a small retail shop. She has been operating the shop for the last eleven years. She also operates a boutique shop, which supplements her income. This marks her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. 

Catherine is requesting a loan from VisionFund Kenya in order to stock her shop with rice, sugar, packed milk, maize meal, cooking oil, and flour. With the additional income she will earn, she will be able to improve the living conditions for her family and support the education of her two children.

In the future, Catherine plans to continue to invest in her business, start money transfer services, and give her children a quality education.

loans.use: to stock her shop with rice, sugar, packed milk, maize meal, cooking oil, and flour

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
Don Cristóbal tiene 56 años, está casado hace mas de 30 años  con la Sra. Genara,  tienen 8 hijos, todos ya mayores, que esta pareja ha podido criar por medio del trabajo de ambos.
El señor Cristóbal es hijo de un agricultor, trabajó en el campo con su padre, a los 26  años de edad se casó con la hija de una tejedora y  empezaron a trabajar juntos, hoy en día  hace mas 20  años que se dedica en  la venta de las tradicionales sobrecamas y hamacas que lo lleva a vender por la zona de Posadas, con una clientela bien  formada, incluso su señora quién es artesana le teje las frazadas y así le sale más barato. Gracias a este trabajo y al esfuerzo de los dos  pudo construir una linda casa para brindar a su familia una vida honrada y digna.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos y color para que su esposa pueda tejer frazadas que en ésta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cristóbal is 56 years old and has been married to Genera for over 30 years. They  have eight grown children who they were able to raise by both working. 

Cristóbal  is the son of a farmer and worked in the fields with his father. At the age of 26 he married the daughter of a weaver and they started working together. 
Now it has been over 20 years since they started selling traditional bedspreads and hammocks in the Posadas area where they have a good clientele. 

His wife who is an artisan,  weaves the blankets and this way it ends up being cheaper. 

Thanks to all this work and to the effort of both they were able to build a nice house to give their family a honest and dignified life.

He is requesting a loan to buy thread and color so his wife can weave blankets as this is their busiest season.

loans.use: to buy thread and color for weaving.

loans.name: Victorine Akouavi's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Victorine Akouavi(celle dont la main est levée sur la photo) est âgée de 46 ans est mariée à un certain Koffi. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et un à leur charge. Victorine Akouavi vit seule avec ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour ce faire depuis quinze ans environs, Victorine Akouavi vend de la nourriture à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Victorine Akouavi vend aussi des tissus par la technique de distribution. Victorine Akouavi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Victorine Akouavi et les membres de son groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en: This group comprises three people who live in the same area. The group leader, named Victorine Akouavi (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 46 years old and married to a man named Kofi. The couple have two children, both in school and in their care. Victorine Akouavi lives alone with her children. The couple provide for the various household expenses together. To do this over the past fifteen years or so, Victorine Akouavi has sold food at her house. On the side, she also sells fabric through the local distribution system. Victorine Akouvi gets her supplies at a market in Benin. This is the first time she and the members of her group are seeking financial support from ALIDÉ, with the goal of strengthening their businesses and being able to meet the demands of their clientele better.

loans.use: To buy maize and condiments

loans.name: Aoua

texts.fr:
Madame AOUA est née en 1976 à Bougouni. Mère de 7 enfants elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Elle mène des activités de commercialisation des habits depuis plus de 10 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes d’habits. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, elle décide de collaborer avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elle est à son  1er prêt individuel.  Ses cinq prêts solidaires ont été correctement remboursés.  Ce prêt individuel lui permettra d’acheter beaucoup d’habits. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako, elle revend les habits au comptant et à crédit, à domicile à une clientèle mixte dans les différents quartiers de la ville de Bougouni. 
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Aoua was born in 1976 in Bougouni. She has seven children and lives in a traditional household in the Massablacoura area of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
She has run a business selling clothing for over ten years. Her experience in this area has earned her a good reputation, and she receives orders for clothing. Thus, to have the necessary resources to satisfy her customers, she decided to work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she is on her first individual loan. Her five solidarity (group) loans were repaid properly. This individual loan will allow her to buy lots of clothing. She gets her supplies in Bamako and resells the clothing in cash and on credit, at home to a mixed clientele from different areas of the city of Bougouni.
With this loan, she foresees realizing an average monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA. This profit will allow her to pay the interest on her loan and invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials, such as fabric, thread and other materials, needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan in order to buy fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her tailoring. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and children’s educations. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Cristy hopes that her business will flourish more and she dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of their work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her tailoring

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is a 31-year-old, married mother with two children, who are all in school.

Jinky has a soft drinks retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more cases of soft drinks to offer for sale.

Jinky has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Jinky would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of soft drinks to offer for sale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan to purchase food ingredients such as wheat flour, onions, beans, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for her business. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as wheat flour, onions, beans, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for her business

loans.name: Yessenia Mabel

texts.es:
Yessenia de 28 años de edad, no estudio, aunque sabe leer y escribir un poco, es acompañada, el esposo trabaja en la agricultura, (cultiva maíz, frijol y maicillo), la niña que tiene, va a parvulario y ellos tres son los que viven en el hogar. Ella se dedica a los oficios del hogar, ayuda a su esposo en ocasiones, en la agricultura y en ocasiones trabaja en un vivero que tiene una cooperativa de la zona.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para ella le cambiara el techo a la vivienda, pues la madera y la teja que tiene ya está deteriorada. (Comprara teja, madera, y pagara mano de obra) sueña con tener un empleo para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos, también con que su hija salga adelante en su estudio, pues por el momento el dinero que obtienen es para el gasto de la familia y el pago del crédito. Aunque piensa que de no ser por el credito no podría hacer lo que hasta ahorita ha hecho con los crédito, como lo es mejorar la casa poco a poco
texts.en:
Yessenia, 28 did not go to school however she knows how to read and write a little bit. 

She has a partner. Her husband works as a farmer (he grows corn, beans and sorghum) and her daughter goes to nursery school. They are the three that live in the house. 

She takes care of the house, sometimes she helps her husband with the farming and sometimes she works in a nursery run by a cooperative in the area. 

She is requesting a loan to replace the roof of her home since the current wood and tile has deteriorated. 

She will buy tiles and wood and pay for the labor. 

She dreams of having a job to help her husband with the expenses. She also wants her daughter to get ahead in her studies. 

At the moment the money they get is for the family expenses and to pay for the loan.
 
Although she thinks that if it weren't for the loan, she would not have been able to do what she has done so far, which is improve the house little by little.

loans.use: to buy tiles and wood and pay for the labor.

loans.name: Fatoumata Siaka

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata Siaka est née en Avril 1961 à Bougouni. Mère de 1 enfant elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Faraba de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Elle mène des activités de commercialisation des habits et des tasses depuis plus de 20 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes d’ habits et des tasses. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, elle collabore avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elle est à son 1er prêt individuel maintenant. Ses huit prêts solidaires ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter une importante quantité d’habits et de tasses avec les grossistes de Bamako.
Elle  les revend au comptant et à crédit, à domicile à une clientèle mixte dans les différents quartiers de la ville de Bougouni.  
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 53 335 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata Siaka was born in April 1961 in Bougouni. She has one child and lives in a traditional household in the Faraba area in the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
She has run a business selling clothing and cups for over twenty years. Her experience in this area has earned her a good reputation and she receives orders for clothing and cups. Thus, in order to have the necessary resources to satisfy her customers, she works with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she is on her first individual loan now. Her eight solidarity (group) loans were repaid properly.
This loan will allow her to buy a significant quantity of clothing and cups from the wholesalers in Bamako.
She resells these items in cash and on credit, at home to a mixed clientele in the different areas of the city of Bougouni.
With this loan, she foresees realizing an average monthly profit of 53,355 FCFA. This profit will allow her to pay the interest on her loan and invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing and cups.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cleaning products for her business, to resell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 46 years old and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Delia has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

Delia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Kadia

texts.fr:
Madame KADIA est née en  Mars 1977 à Bougouni. Mère de 7 enfants elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Heremakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle mène des activités de commercialisation des habits, chaussures et pommades depuis plus de 7 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes d’habits, de chaussures et de pommades. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, elle collabore avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elle est à son  2 ème prêt individuel. Le premier prêt a été correctement remboursé.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter  une grande quantité d’habits, de chaussures et de pommades.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako. Elle les revend au comptant et à crédit, à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes dans les différents quartiers de la ville de Bougouni. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
Elle compte devenir un grossiste à Bougouni.
texts.en:
Ms. Kadia was born in March 1977 in Bougouni. She has seven children and lives in a traditional household in the North Heremakono area in the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
She has run a business selling clothing, shoes, and ointments for over seven years. Her experience in this area has earned her a good reputation and she receives orders for clothing, shoes, and ointments. Thus, in order to have the necessary resources to satisfy her customers, she works with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she is on her second individual loan. The previous loan was repaid properly.
This loan will allow her to buy a significant quantity of clothing, shoes, and ointments.
